Organiza un grupo de mujeres y solicitan un préstamo que sera invertido para la ampliación de su negocio tanto para la compra de helados y la compra de verduras para la venta, espera en el futuro tener un negocio amplio y con mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Thirty-three year old Maria is married and did not have the opportunity to study.  She has six children, four of whom are in education.  She has a business selling ice-creams and vegetables.  Having started this business with only a little money, she now has nine years experience and her business is going well.  She receives support from her husband who works in agriculture.

Maria is organising a group of women that is applying for a loan to be invested in expanding their business, as well as in buying ice-creams and vegetables that will be sold on.  In the future, Maria hopes to have a bigger business with higher profits.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell on.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El señor Julio habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, en el barrio La Borgoña, trabaja la tierra desde hace muchos años junto a su papa, gracias a sus cultivos ha logrado realizar su casa y mantener a su familia, con este nuevo financiamiento comprara Fertilizantes e insumos para darle un optimo  mantenimiento a una manzana de Piña, comprara: Urea, Triple 20, Manzate con esto podra combatir la plaga y el daño que provoca el clima, muy agradecido con Afodenic quien atraves de fondos Kiva le han apoyado varios años.
texts.en: Julio lives in the town of Ticuantepe, in the La Borgoña district.  He has been farming for many years alongside his father and, thanks to his crops, he has built his house and can maintain his family.  With the new loan, Julio will buy fertiliser and materials to optimise his pineapple field.  He will buy urea, Triple 20 and Manzate, which will be used to combat plague and damaged caused by the climate.  Julio is very grateful to Afodenic which, through Kiva, has supported him for many years.

loans.use: to buy materials to maintain crops.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a 36-year-old, married woman from Alicia, Bohol and a mother of four children. She has run an eatery or carenderia in her place for more than six years, selling home-cooked foods to the people in her place.

Cheryl is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients for food-vending, like meat, vegetables, and seasonings. With these ingredients, she will be able to cook and sell more, thus, augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Cheryl dreams of making her business a success and saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for food-vending, like meat, vegetables, and seasonings.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel is 42 year old and is engaged in buying and selling of fish as a source of income. She helps her husband in supporting their poor living through this occupation. With the desire to improve their poor living, Raquel is requesting a loan amount of 10,000 PHP to buy more fish and meat to sell in the market to have more income for their daily needs. She hopes to materialize it through her diligence and determination.

loans.use: to buy more fish and meat to sell

loans.name: Roukiatou

texts.fr: Roukiéatou est une dame de 47ans. Mariée à un retraité, ils ont 02 enfants en charge tous sur les bancs d’école. Ils sont âgés de 16 et 09ans. Pour prêter main forte à son conjoint, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente des pagnes et bijoux. Activité, qu’elle a démarré en 1997 dans un marché de la ville de Lomé. Étant une ancienne cliente de WAGES, elle fait son troisième crédit pour acheter plus de marchandises (pagnes et bijoux). Elle voudrait à l’avenir ouvrir une boutique et s’occuper plus de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Roukiéatou is a 47 year old woman. She is married to a pensioner and they have two dependent children both of which attend school. They are 16 and 9 years old. To give her husband a hand, to generate some income, she sells traditional fabric and jewellery. She started this business in 1997 at a market in Lomé. Being a previous Wages client, she requests her third loan in order to purchase a greater quantity of merchandise (fabric and jewellery). In the future she would like to open a boutique and contribute more to the costs of sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabrics and jewellery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics, new clothes and footwear.

loans.name: Alanood Group

texts.en:
Alanood group are 5 members who live in Hodeida, Yemen. 

Shwayah is 25 years old, a mother of two boys; a two-year-old and four-month-old. Right after her husband's car accident, Shwayah started to work as a door-to-door saleswoman, selling clothes and vegetables. She has applied for a loan to buy different types of vegetables and clothes.

loans.use: to buy different types of vegetables and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cows for resale.

loans.name: Edouard

texts.en:
Edouard is a 37-year-old, married father of six children, between the ages of 3 and 17 years. He also takes care of one relative. 

Edouard has been selling meat for 14 years and currently employs four people to help him. The hours of his business are from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m., Monday through Friday, every week. This loan is his third.

Edouard has requested a Kiva loan, via Vision Finance Company, in order to buy a large quantity of meat to roast for sale. With the profits, he will be able to buy more food for the family, renovate his house, and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of meat to roast for sale.

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Heba is a 30-year-old, single woman who opened a cafeteria 4 years ago to make her living. She sells coffee, tea, and hot chocolate, in addition to special fresh juices, biscuits, nuts, chocolates and chips.

Heba is working hard to improve her business, that's why she introduced her customers to new brands to be sold such as bags and women's needs. She is requesting a youth loan from Al Majmoua to improve her business capital by buying new scarf collections and bags for the winter season. Heba is an expert in this field, since she used to work in a café before she started her own business, and is improving her women's needs section with bags and scarfs. Most of her customers are her neighboring villagers in addition to newly attracted customers, because of the newly added products.

Heba is already an Al Majmoua borrower, and her previous loan helped a lot in improving her business and increasing her income. She is sure that this loan will also have the same positive effect. She hopes to keep on expanding her business more and more to attract new customers, and to open a separate scarfs and bags shop to increase her income.

loans.use: To start selling women's scarfs and bags

loans.name: Hesbon

texts.en:
Hesbon is a 36-year-old gentleman and a father of four children, ages 10, 8, 7 and 4, respectively. Hesbon is a mechanic who is also involved in welding activities in Bomet county.

He has acquired a first loan from KADET LTD of 10,000 KES that will facilitate him in acquiring additional welding tools. He plans to use the anticipated profit to expand his business as well as support his family.

His hopes and dreams are to have a large business and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy welding materials

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia has been in the business for five years, since she borrowed a loan from ASKI to start her business computer services. She offers games, encoding, and makes occasions cards. Lydia is 42 years old, married, and has two children. At present, Lydia enjoys running the business. Her goal is to increase her income, to further support her family's necessities. 

Lydia is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy computer accessories, like a headphone, a printer, and a webcam. She hopes to encourage more customers and be able to meet her goal.

loans.use: to buy computer accessories for her business, like a headphone, a printer and a webcam.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites, a 39-year-old mother of three children, is married to a farmer who grows rice in their field. Maricel started a mini bakery business in the market some time ago, and upon achieving sufficient earnings established a grocery store as an additional source of family income. As her family grows, so do her household expenditures, so she and her husband work hard to meet their family's needs.

As her children prepare to enter college, education expenditures will become greater. Marites therefore wishes to expand her business into another municipality to increase her earnings. She is thus requesting a loan of P50,000 to buy grocery items such as drinks, spices, biscuits, and canned goods to sell. She hopes to expand the business soon.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like drinks, spices, biscuits, and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cows for resale.

loans.name: Merry Jean

texts.en:
Merry Jean owns and manages a small variety store in her community to generate income. She is 36 years old and has two school-age children. She and her husband aim to become financially stable in order to support the education of their children and to give them a better life. Despite hardships and difficulties in life, she has the determination to achieve her goals. 

Merry Jean wants to improve her variety store in order to increase her income. To work out her plan, she is asking for additional capital of 5,000 PHP to buy more soft drinks, snack foods, biscuits, beverages, candies, and seasonings for sale. She believes that her loan will enable her to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, snack foods, biscuits, beverages, candies, and seasonings for sale.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is from Iraq. He is a youth client, aged 22 and single, and he lives with four family members, one of whom is employed.

Nabil has a small shop where he sells mobile phones and accessories. He established his business in 2000. He built up experience in this field, and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Nabil is requesting a youth loan of 2,700 USD to renovate his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Akoélé

texts.fr: Couturière et revendeuse de pagnes, de tissus et bazins depuis 2001 dans une boutique, Akoélé est mère de 03 enfants âgés de 10, 07 et 02ans. Deux d’entre eux sont sur les bancs d’école. Âgée de 36ans, elle a pour conjoint un commerçant. Pour subvenir aux besoins des clients, elle fait un second crédit à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises. Aidée par 10 personnes, elle voudrait à l’avenir développer son commerce et construire des maisons de locations.
texts.en: Akoélé is a dressmaker and has been selling traditional fabrics and bazins in a shop since 2001. She has three children aged ten, seven and two years old. Two of them attend school. Akoélé is 36 and is married to a storekeeper. To meet her customers' demands, she requests a second loan from WAGES to purchase more merchandise. She has ten people helping her and in the future she would like to expand her business and build houses for renting.

loans.use: to buy traditional dress and fabrics.

loans.name: Alkamar Group

texts.en:
The Alkamar group is made up of four members who live in Hodeidah, Yemen.

Najwa is a 32-year-old mother of 7 kids. She has managed to get a loan from her work, and started to sell some womens' and kids' clothes to her co-workers and neighborhood. She has applied for a loan from AMB  in order to buy clothes to fulfill extra demand. She hopes that by doing so, she will be able to do the necessary maintenance and repair for her house very soon.

loans.use: to buy clothes to fulfill extra demand.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 29-year-old, married man with four children, living in Kagadi, Uganda. He operates a video hall which he started with savings from agriculture. He began this business in order to improve and develop the family's well-being. He would like to start a new business and even expand on the existing one. Late payments are factors affecting the growth of the business. 

Moses is requesting a loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is a 56-year-old married father of three children between the ages of 5 and 25 years. Alphonse has been selling cows and goats for 30 years. He works from 6am to 6pm, Monday through Saturday. 

Alphonse has requested his third Kiva loan, via Vision Finance Company, in order to buy more cows and goats for sale. With the profits, he will be able to buy more food for his family.

loans.use: to buy more cows and goats for resale.

loans.name: Nurul Hikmah 5 Group

texts.en:
"Nurul Hikmah 5 " is a group of 6 people whose members live in the same village but have different businesses. The group's leader, Asih, is 40 years old and has one child still at Senior High School. 

Asih has been selling some kinds of cooked food beside her house since 2002. This business has been running well until now. From this income, she can provide her family's daily needs and help her family near her house. Her dream is to have her own house and have an employee to help her cooking.

Asih and the other members of the "Nurul Hikmah 5" group are requesting financial support from VisionFund Indonesia for the 2nd time so that they can increase their working capital. Asih will use it to buy rice, seasonings, chicken and fish. The rainy season is her obstacle to selling her food. The other members have a laundry business and sell cookies and soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken and seasoning for her food

loans.name: Mayela Melissa

texts.es: La señora Mayela vive en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo quien tiene su propio negocio, ella labora para u na empresa privada  y junto se comparten los gastos del hogar y los gastos de sus dos hijos, Mayela varios años lleva luchando para terminar su casa pero su dificultad es que no ganan lo suficiente para terminarla, con este nuevo credito que se le ha otorgado comprara parte del Zinc y perlines para ponerle el techo a su vivienda y poquito en poquito terminarla, muy agradecido con Afodenic y fondos Kiva por el apoyo que le han brindado.
texts.en: Mayela lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her husband who has his own business. She works in a private business and together they share the household and their two children's expenses. Mayela has struggled for many years to finish her house but her difficulty has been that she does not earn enough to finish it. With this new loan that has been provided to her she will buy metal sheeting and beams to install a roof in her home and finish it little by little. She is very thankful for Afodenic and Kiva's funds for the support that they have brought to her.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Don Jaime es una persona humilde que se dedica a la crianza y venta de chanchos en la ciudad de Tulcán, él se describe como una persona humilde, honesta, responsable y muy trabajadora, Jaime vive junto a sus padres, en este año piensa contraer matrimonio, y es por ello que esta entusiasta en seguir trabajando con más fuerza para salir adelante y tener dinero para solventar los gastos de su familia.
El crédito que Jaime solicita a FODEMI, se lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos pequeños rosados y un chancho reproductor, inversión que ayudara a seguir creciendo en la producción y venta.
El sueño que Jaime tiene es el tener una familia, y trabajar para darles todo, mientras tanto Jaime sigue con la idea de ser un productor y distribuidor de chanchos para los mercados de su ciudad.
texts.en:
Jaime is a humble person who makes a living raising and selling pigs in the city of Tulcán. He is described as a humble, honest, responsible and very hard working person. Jaime lives with his parents. This year he plans to marry and it is for this reason that he is enthusiastic to continue working hard to get ahead and have money to cover his family's expenses. 

The loan that Jaime is requesting from FODEMI will be invested in buying some small pigs and one pig for breeding. This investment will help him to continue growing in production and sales. 

Jaime's dream is to have a family and work to give them everything. Jaime continues his idea of being a producer and distributor of pigs for the city's markets.

loans.use: to buy small pigs and one pig for breeding.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
At 52, Josephine is still actively engaged in running her sari-sari store, or convenience store, where she sells snack foods and drinks in her village. Josephine is a widowed mother of four children. 

Josephine hopes for good health and to continue operating and growing her business. Josephine is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy canned goods, soap, and eggs to expand the variety of products she sells to her customers. She hopes to develop her business and become a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: to expand the variety of products she sells to her customers.

loans.name: Amarbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Amarbayar, 25, lives with his wife, mother, and three-year-old child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family resides in their own house on his mother-in-law’s plot of land. He has been working as a welder at a private company for two years. Currently his wife is staying at home in order to care for their child. His mother-in-law is retired. 

Mr. Amarbayar is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase a small automobile that runs on natural gas. This will improve the family's standarad of living and can also be used for taxi services. Another advantage of an automobile that runs on natural gas is that it emits less smoke, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase a car that runs on natural gas.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith de 25 años está casada con Joel de 29. Ellos tienen 2 hijos de 4 y 1 año de edad. Esta familia habita una vivienda alquilada y se ubica en un caserío rural.
Edith es una mujer esmerada. Desde los 19 años trabaja en múltiples actividades como: la agricultura, la ganadería y el negocio.
Pero la que más satisfacciones le genera es la venta de productos de primera necesidad. Para ello habilitó un puesto de ventas en su hogar. Expende carnes, verduras, frutas, abarrotes, conservas, bebidas, etc. “En todos estos años mi tienda ha crecido, por eso me siento contenta porque todo lo que ahora tengo, lo conseguí a base de esfuerzo”, dice.
Dos veces a la semana viaja hasta la ciudad de Tarma (1 hora de viaje), para adquirir la mercadería necesaria.
Edith considera que el trabajo es constante en su tienda, por ello requiere de su ayuda para obtener un préstamo y continuar con sus metas de emprendimiento. Éste es su crédito número 2 con MFP. Está agradecida por la confianza y confirma su voluntad de pago puntualmente.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de mercadería como: abarrotes, verduras, bebidas y otros comestibles, y así abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Edith is 25 years old and married to Joel, age 29. They have two children, aged 4 and 1. This family lives in a rented home, located in a rural settlement. 

Edith is a hard-working woman. Since the age of 19, she has worked in a range of fields such as agriculture, livestock raising and business. 

But what gives her the most satisfaction is selling basic staple goods. For this purpose, she set up a sales stand in her home. She offers meat, vegetables, fruits, groceries, canned goods, beverages, etc. "In all of these years my store has grown, and I feel happy because I obtained everything I have today from my efforts," she says. 

Twice a week she travels to the city of Tarma (1 hour away) to acquire the merchandise she needs.

Edith reports that the work is constant in her store, and thus she needs your help to obtain a loan and continue toward her entrepreneurial goals. This is loan number 2 for her with MFP. She is grateful for the confidence placed in her and confirms her determination to pay punctually. 

She will invest the money in buying merchandise such as groceries, vegetables, beverages and other edible products, in order to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, vegetables, beverages and other edible products to stock her business.

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en:
Kareem is from Iraq. He is 50 years old, married, and the father of three children. Kareem provides the family's only income.

Kareem has a shop where he sells cement and other construction supplies. He established his business in 2008, and now he has an employee. He has built up experience in this field, and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Kareem is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to renovate his shop. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is from Iraq. He is a single youth client. He is 25 years old and lives with five family members, of whom three are employed.

Ahmad owns an internet café. He specializes in providing video games for his customers. He used to be employed at a shop where he bought and sold electronics, but he had a dream of making his own career. He established his business in 2007. He built up good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a youth loan of $3,000 to pay the yearly rent of his shop and to buy some electronics. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide himself better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the yearly rent of his shop and to buy some electronics.

loans.name: Singkarak Indah 1 Group

texts.en:
Lilis is the leader of an 8-person group named “Singkarak Indah 1”. They live at Sukmajaya, a village in the east near Jakarta. Lilis is a mother (25 years old) with three children, and two of her children are in college and senior high school.

Lilis has a business in her house selling some kinds of clothes.  She sells blouses, children's clothes, t-shirts and some kinds of adult clothes.  She started her business 3 years ago. From this business, Lilis can supply her family's needs and help her to pay school fees. Her dream is to have a shop and expand her business.

Lilis and the other members of the "Singkarak Indah 1" group are requesting financial support from VisionFund Indonesia for the 2nd time so that they can increase their working capital. Lilis will use it to buy and add to her goods: blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothes. Having many competitors around her environment is her obstacle in running this business, but she enjoys it.

loans.use: to buy clothes for children and adults

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 27 years old. He is single and lives with 2 family members. Ali is the only provider of the family.

Ali owns a shop for selling used tires for all types of cars. He established his business in 2007. He built good experience in this field and he is becoming well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a sum of $3,000 in a youth loan to install signage, a rolling shutter and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to install signage, a rolling shutter and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beer and soda to sell

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is from Iraq. He is 55 years old, married, and the father of three children, two of whom are employed.

Rashid is a mechanic. He established his business in 1994 and specializes in repairing European cars. He has built up experience in this field, and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Rashid is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD to renovate his shop. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married, and has three children. Moustafa provides the family's only income.

Moustafa owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents, and snacks. He established his business in 2004, and now he has an employee. He has built up experience in this field, and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Moustafa is requesting a loan of 2,100 USD to pay the annual rent for his grocery store. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his grocery store.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is a 30-year-old married man with 2 children aged 7 and 1 living in Kagadi, Uganda. He owns a soda depot that he started five years ago. With the proceeds, he has been able to establish a produce business to supplement his income.

He dreams of constructing a permanent house for his family and buying land for farming, despite inadequate capital that limits his business growth. Jimmy intends to use the loan to buy soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy soda to sell

loans.name: Claudia Cristina

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer de 37 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus tres hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, lastimosamente Claudia sufrió la pérdida de su amado esposo, desde entonces ella ha dedicado todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Claudia no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libre le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Res para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Claudia trabaja en su pequeña anticuchería, ella vende deliciosos anticuchos, pancita, hígado, tripitas y otros, ella trabaja todos los días y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 6 horas, Claudia se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Claudia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder construir la parte delantera y fachada de su vivienda, y que está actualmente es de estera, de esta manera Claudia podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su restaurant propio.
texts.en:
Claudia is 37 years old and lives in the city of Nazca with her three children.  She loves her three children and says they are her main reason for living.  Sadly, she suffered the loss of her beloved husband, and since then she has dedicated all of her efforts to providing for her family.  Regrettably, although she would have liked very much to study a professional career, she was not able to do so because of a lack of economic resources and needing to work to cover her expenses.

In her free moments Claudia likes to watch television, and on certain occasions she cooks a delicious Seco de Res [a cilantro beef stew] to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with a lot of effort and determination, Claudia works in her small food stall, where she sells delicious kebabs, tripe and liver, among other things.  She works everyday for approximately six hours.  Claudia feels comfortable while working her business, which she thinks does well because she is a good cook and treats her clients with kindness.

Claudia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support she will be able to buy construction materials.  She will use these to build the front part and façade of her home, which currently consists of straw matting.  In this way, Claudia will be able to increase her family’s security and welfare, and she will continue working and striving to achieve her greatest dream, which is to have her own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Emprendedoras - 26 Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento EMPRENDEDORAS – 26 ya está en su segunda secuencia cambiaron integrantes ya que hubo problemas con las integrantes que salieron pero se reestructuró y ahora cuenta con nueve integrantes ocho  mujeres y un varón,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Rosaicela tiene 33 años y es casada con 3 hijos que son de las edades de 12, 8 y 6 años,  ella se dedica a la fabricación y venta  de  variedad de peluches en su taller que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Tembladerani, la Sra.  Rosaicela va a usar este préstamo para la compra de materia prima por su negocio como tela de peluche por mayor y ojos de plástico,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo y  va a utilizar los beneficios en ahorrar para comprar una casa más grande y  tener negocio  rentable.
texts.en: The “Emprendedoras-26” communal bank is in its second sequence.  They've had some membership changes because there were problems with the members that left the group but it was restructured and now has nine members: 8 women and 1 man.  The bank’s president is Rosaicela, 33.  She’s married and has three children aged 12, 8 and 6 years.  She works making and selling a variety of stuffed toys.  Her workshop is located in the Tembladerani zone.  Rosaicela will use the loan to buy raw materials like fabric at wholesale and plastic eyeballs to make the toys.  Her reason for requesting the loan is the lack of cash and she will use profits to save up to buy a bigger house and to have a profitable business.

loans.use: to buy fabric and plastic eyeballs to make stuffed toys.

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is 55 years old and a hard-working housewife. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan with her husband, three daughters, and two sons. Two of her children are government employees, one is a driver, and another is a student. Her husband is a taxi driver and trying his best to provide for his family's needs. But currently he is unable to generate any income from the taxi, as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired. 

Zubaida, as a member of a five-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to pay for engine repairs for her husband's taxi. With the profit from the taxi, her husband wants to open a new auto mechanic shop. Zubaida wants to provide a quality education to all her children, and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very thankful to BRAC for this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay for engine repairs for her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Agustin Porfirio

texts.es: El señor Agustin habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, agricultor desde hace 15 años, su esposa es comerciante y le apoya en todas las deciciones ya que son para el bienestar de la familia, el a trabajado mucho para sacar a sus hijos adelante, con este nuevo credito compra lo que necesita para darle un optimo mantenimiento a su cultivo de Piña ya que comprara Fertilizantes, Urea, Completo, inseptisidas. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic le ha brindo con ayuda de Fondos Kiva durante estos años.
texts.en: Agustin lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe and has been in agriculture for 15 years. His wife is a vendor and supports him in all the decisions made because they are for the well-being of the family. He has worked hard to move his kids forward. With this new loan he will buy what he needs to provide optimum maintenance to his pineapple crops. He will buy fertilizers, urea and insecticides. He is thankful for the support that Afodenic has brought him with the help of Kiva funds during these years.

loans.use: to buy maintenance supplies for his crops.

loans.name: Marieta Ybann

texts.es: La Sra. Marieta tiene 42 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos de las edades de 5, 10, 18 y 20 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de tarjetas y regalos adornos material de escritorio y juguetes, ella vende variedad de productos según a la temporada, tiene ubicado su bazar en la zona de Pampahasi, ella vive en casa familiar, ella solicita el crédito para proveerse de mercadería con la compra de material para surtir su bazar ya que le va muy bien ya que por la ubicación del negocio tiene una buena venta la Sra. Marieta una persona responsable y trabajadora, agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Marieta, 42, has four children aged 5, 10, 18 and 20.  She works selling a variety of greeting cards, gifts, decorations, office supplies and toys.  She sells a variety of goods according to the season.  Her store is located in the Pampahasi zone.  She lives in the family home and is requesting the loan to stock up on merchandise; she will purchase merchandise to stock her store since she does very well due to the store’s good location.  Her sales are very good.  Marieta’s a responsible, hardworking person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like greeting cards, toys and decorations.

loans.name: San Martin De Porres  -  32 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento SAN MARTIN DE PORRES  -  32 está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón,  la presidenta del  banco es la Sra. Sandra  tiene 33 años y tiene cuatro hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar,  ella se dedica a la  venta de juguetes en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en uno de los mercados más concurridos de la ciudad de  Cochabamba,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Sandra  va a usar este préstamo para compra de juguetes por mayor para surtir su  negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es crecimiento de su negocio, la Sra. Sandra  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la mismo mercado donde vende existen varias personas que se dedican a la misma actividad, va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar sus productos y su calidad de vida. Su deseo  para su negocio es montar una tienda propia y poder exponer la variedad de juguetes que tiene para la venta.
texts.en: The “San Martin de Porres-32” communal bank has 8 members: 7 women and 1 man.  The bank president is Sandra, 33.  She has four school-age children.  She works selling toys in a sales stand located in one of Cochabamba’s better known markets.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Sandra will use the loan to buy toys at wholesale to stock her business.  Her reason for requesting the loan is for business growth.  The business challenge Sandra faces is competition because there are several others in the same market she works in that do the same thing as she does.  She will use profits to improve her products and her quality of life.  Her wish for her business is to open a store of her own to display the variety of toys she has available for sale.

loans.use: to buy toys.

loans.name: Gurban

texts.en: Gurban is a 37-year-old married man with two children ages 10 and 16. He lives with his parents, and they are pensioners. He is trying his best to earn extra income for the family and enhance their way of living. Gurban started working as a vehicle repairer eight years ago. He learned this profession through many years of experience, and he is always improving his craft. His eldest son helps him with his work. The reason he requested the loan is to develop his business. He decided to buy a very old car, reassemble it, and resell it for a good price. The profit will be used to purchase the needed metal supplies to carry on his work in a proper way, to stand firm in the world of business, and to be a good example for his sons.

loans.use: To buy an old car, reassemble it, and resell it

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en:
Mr. Bat-Erdene is 53 years old and lives with his wife and granddaughter in a small house in the Orhon province of Mongolia. His wife Davaatseren, age 47, helps her husband to run the family business and care for their three-year-old granddaughter, Amin-Erdene. 

Mr. Bat-Erdene and his wife used to run a small grocery store. They closed their store because it became unprofitable when larger stores opened nearby. 

Mr. Bat-Erdene is now requesting 3,500,000 MNT to purchase equipment and machinery to start his own wooden furniture manufacturing business. He used to work at a furniture manufacturing company before he started his grocery store. He is a hardworking, diligent, and clever person.

loans.use: to start his own wooden furniture manufacturing business.

loans.name: Norlan Aaron

texts.es: El joven Norlan tiene 36 años, estudio una carrera técnica en mecánica, trabaja en su profesión y también tiene una pequeña pulpería que cuida su esposa mientras el anda trabajando, ambos tienen un hijo de diez años que va a la escuela, Norlan quiere levantar un poco más la pared trasera de su casa para brindar mayor seguridad al predio de la casa y por su puesto a la familia para lograr este objetivo solicita apoyo de crédito por primera vez con Afodenic para comprar cemento, arena, bloques, piedrines, hierro y pagara la mano de obra, como planes futuros desea ampliar mas su negocio para ir creciendo poco a poco.
texts.en: Norlan, 36, is studying for a degree in mechanics.  He works in his profession, and also has a small grocery store that his wife tends to while he goes to work.  Together they have a son, 10, who attends school.  Norlan wants to raise the wall at the back of his house a bit higher to provide better security to his property and family.  To do this, he is requesting a loan for the first time from Afodenic to buy cement, sand, cement blocks, gravel, and steel, and also to pay for labor.  In the future, he wants to expand his business and grow it over time.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, cement blocks, gravel, and steel, and also to pay for labor

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie has operated her hog raising business for more than 25 years. She is happily married with five children. Her main goal in life is to have a better profit so she can sustain the family's daily commodities and improve their way of living.

Rosie would like to maintain her hog raising business, but due to insufficient capital she has, she is asking for additional capital of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). She will use this loan amount to buy livestock feed and vitamins to ensure proper growth of her hogs. She knows that with this loan amount, she could grow her hog business. Rosie hopes that her requested loan amount will be granted to help her gain her goal in life.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and vitamins for her raised hogs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing for men and women, cosmetics, and assorted footwear.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Doña gloria siempre trabajando en el colegio como conserje y vendiendo fritanga en las afueras de su casa por la noche desde hace  varios años hace este gran sacrificio para sacar adelante a sus hijos, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien también trabaja como guarda de seguridad en la misma escuela que ella, con este nuevo crédito piensa levantar la pared de su casa que lo tiene cubierto de laminas de zinc usadas y ya están oxidadas, gracias a los  créditos que los ha aprovechado al máximo en la construcción de su casa esta vez comprara bloques, cemento, hierro, arena y pagara la mano de obra y poco a poco irá terminando la mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Gloria continues to work in the school as a janitor and for many years she has sold popular fried food outside her house at night. This grand sacrifice she makes to advance her children. Gloria can count on the help of her husband who works with her in the same school as a security guard.

With this new loan she will rebuild a house wall that is presently covered with used zinc sheeting that has rusted. Gloria has taken maximum advantage of past loans to construct her home. On this occasion, she wishes to buy blocks, cement, iron and sand, and pay workers for, little by little, finishing these improvements on her home.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, iron, and sand, and to pay laborers for home repairs.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 49 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus tres hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a sus hijos, ya que ella es padre y madre para ellos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Rosa no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho ser una gran Cosmetóloga, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocina deliciosos postres y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Rosa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida, con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, así como dos vitrinas y andamio, de esta manera podrá abastecer su negocio y atender a más clientes, así pues Rosa seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar su negocio y tener su propio local de ventas.
texts.en:
Rose, 40, lives in the city of Cañete, Imperial district, with her three children, whom she loves and are her main reason for living. She is a very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person, who puts all her effort into advancing her children, since she is mother and father to them. Sadly, because of a lack of economic resources, and the need to work to meet her expenses, Rosa was unable to study a professional degree. But she would have liked to be a great cosmetician. In her free time, she likes to make delicious desserts and sometime she cooks a delicious "arroz con pollo" (chicken with rice) to share with her family. 

On her own initiative, and with a lot of effort and dedication, Rosa works in her small business selling clothing, for men, women, and children. She works every day starting early in the morning and she can work for about eight hours. She is very comfortable in her work and believes that it is going well for her because of the friendly way that she treats her customers. Rosa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help, she will be able to buy merchandise for her business, as well as two display cabinets and shelving. This way, she can stock her business and attend to more customers. Rosa will continue working and striving to achieve her big dream of expanding her business and having her own establishment.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (men's and women's clothing).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Claveles Group

texts.es:
Claveles es un grupo solidario conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras y muy trabajadoras, que buscan la manera de salir adelante y de cumplir cada uno de sus sueños a base de trabajo, sacrificio y esfuerzo diario.
La presidenta de este grupo solidario es la señora  Verónica una mujer valiente llena  de virtudes y de altos valores cristianos, ella es una mujer de 24 años tiene tres hijos vive junto a su esposo e hijos en la ciudad de Latacunga. Verónica se define como una mujer  humilde, honesta, muy trabajadora y entusiasta, es por ello que se ha sabido ganar el aprecio y reconocimiento de su comunidad.
El crédito solicitado a FODEMI se lo invertirá en la compra de plantas de claveles para sembrar en el invernadero que tienen, siendo una inversión rentable ya que produce gran cosecha y sus claveles son muy cotizados en todo el centro del país.
El sueño que la Sra. Verónica tiene es seguir trabajando y ampliar su pequeña microempresa, teniendo más invernaderos y sembrando rosas y claveles, y ser una de las principales distribuidoras de rosas para su cuidad y el país.
texts.en:
Claveles is a supportive group made up of three enterprising and very hard-working women who are looking for a way to come out ahead and to achieve each one of their dreams through work, sacrifice, and daily effort.

The president of this supportive group is Veronica, a courageous woman full of virtues and high Christian values. She is a 24-year-old woman who has three children. She lives with her husband and children in the city of Latacunga. Veronica defines herself as a humble, honest, very hard-working, and enthusiastic woman. It is because of this that she has gained the regard and recognition of her community.

The loan requested from FODEMI will be invested in the purchase of carnation plants to plant in the greenhouse that they have. This is a worthwhile investment since it produces a large harvest and their carnations are highly valued in the entire center of the country.

The dream that Veronica has is to continue working and increase her small micro-company by having more greenhouses and planting roses and carnations, and to be one of the principle distributors of roses for her city and the country.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of carnation plants to plant in the greenhouse that they have.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.es:
Nadia es cobradora de una institución, vive sola en la zona de Miraflores y es estudiante de Marketing en una universidad de la ciudad de La Paz.

No tiene un hogar propio por lo que constantemente debe incurrir en gastos grandes para mantener su hogar.

El crédito lo requiere para poder continuar sus estudios este año y así, con el tiempo, terminar su carrera y poder postular a un mejor empleo para mejorar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Nadia es poder tener una casa propia donde pueda vivir tranquila.

Es primera vez que solicita crédito con Kiva.
texts.en: Nadia works as a bill collector for an institution.  She lives alone in the Miraflores zone and is studying Marketing in a university in the city of La Paz.  She does not have a home of her own so she must constantly expend large sums to maintain her home.  She needs the loan to be able to continue with her studies this year so that she can complete her career in time and be able to have access to better jobs and improved income.  Nadia’s dream is to have a house of her own so she can live in with peace of mind.  This is the first time she’s requested a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to pay room and board to continue with her Marketing studies.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Madame Akouvi vit avec ses enfants à Lomé. Elle est âgée de 33ans et est revendeuse de produits de beauté et des bijoux depuis 2011. Elle le fait de façon ambulante et sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle veut avoir une boutique pour éviter de se promener et assurer l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akouvi, age 33, lives with her children in Lomé. She has been a reseller of beauty products and jewelry since 2011, and she conducts her business door-to-door. 

She is seeking a first loan from WAGES to stock up on merchandise. 

In the long term, she would like to open a store so as not to have to walk around any longer, and she also wants to provide for her children’s education.

loans.use: to stock up on beauty products and jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es:
Jairo de 31 años de edad, padre de familia con tres hijos menores de edad de 13, 7,3 años, se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Él es originario de Chinandega lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado ser ingeniero en sistema.
Gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor es que tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general  que consisten en la venta de pantalones, short, juegos de toallas, camisas, camisetas, ropa interior, ropa de cama. La rutina de Jairo es trabajar unas 12 horas diarias recorriendo varios municipios del país, ofreciendo sus productos a clientes fijos y eventuales. el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y  aprovechar la entrada de clases de niños y jóvenes para ofrecer uniformes de colegio, calcetas, camisetas, pantalones de colegios faldas de colegios. Y de dicha forma en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos económicos y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Jairo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabaja digno.
texts.en:
Jairo, 31, is a father of three minor children who are 13-, 7- and 3-years-old.  He’s noted for being very hardworking and responsible with a strong drive for self-improvement.  He’s from Chinandega, a place located in the western part of the country.  Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources he was unable to study at university but would have loved to be a systems engineer.

Thanks to his enterprising spirit, his economic activity is selling general merchandise consisting in pants, shorts, towel sets, shirts, t-shirts, underwear and bed linens.  Jairo’s daily routine is to work 12 hours going from town to town in the country offering his goods to regular and occasional customers.  The loan’s goal is to invest in working capital and take advantage of the children’s and youngsters’ return to classes to sell school uniforms, socks, t-shirts, school pants and skirts.  In this way in the not too distant future earn higher income and meet customer demand.  Jairo is grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide people of scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a way to earn a living with dignity.

loans.use: to buy clothes and bed linens.

loans.name: Idalia Agustina

texts.es: Doña Idalia tiene 52 años de edad, es soltera lleva 5 años de tener su propio salón de belleza, su hija también trabaja con ella en el salón, este primer crédito solicitado lo necesita para comprar una silla para barbería ya que tiene bastante demanda y los clientes esperan y solamente tiene una silla, también compraría materiales como tinte para cabello, así prestaría mejor servicio y atención a los clientes, sus planes a futuro es poner un centro de belleza más grande para que sus clientes tengan mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Idalia is fifty-two years old and is single.  She has had her own beauty salon for five years.  Her daughter also works with her in the salon.

This is the first loan she is requesting; she needs it to buy a barber chair since there is already a lot of demand and currently, her clients have to wait since there is only one chair.  She would also buy materials for hair, like dye.  In doing this, she will offer the best service and attention to her clients.  

Her plans for the future are to have a larger beauty center, so that her clients can be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy a barber chair and hair dyes.

loans.name: Dúo Tu En Mi Group

texts.es:
DUO TÚ EN MÍ
ESTE DUO LO CONFORMA LA SEÑORA NATALIA, YA CONOCIDA POR FAPE
COMO SOCIA RESPONSABLE Y PUNTUAL EN SUS PAGOS. ES EL SEGUNDO CREDITO QUE SOLICITA. Y ELLA HA UTILIZADO EL DINERO PARA CULTIVAR MAIZ, FRIJOL, CAFÉ, CRIAR Y ENGORDAR ANIMALES. ELLA ES MUY TRABAJADORA QUE LUCHA CADA DIA PARA AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO CON EL SUSTENTO DIARIO DEL HOGAR.ES MADRES DE FAMILIA POR LO QUE LA HACE AUN MAS LUCHADORA Y CON ANIMO DE SALIR ADELANTE Y ASI PODER BRINDARLE LO MEJOR A SUS HIJOS. SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE SEMILLAS, ABONO QUIMICO Y ORGANICO, ASI MISMO POLLOS, MARRANOS Y CONCENTRADO DE ENGORDE Y CRECIMIENTO.
texts.en:
“Tú en Mí” (You in Me) Duo

Natalia is a member of this duo.  She’s well-known by FAPE for being responsible and punctually making her payments.  This is her second loan request and she’s used the money for her corn and bean crops and to raise and fatten up animals.  She’s very hardworking and strives daily to help her husband support their home.  She’s a mother which makes her work even harder aiming at getting ahead and being able to provide her children the best.  She’s requesting the loan to buy seeds, chemical and organic manure as well as chickens, pigs and animal feed.

loans.use: to buy seeds, chemical and organic manure as well as chickens, pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Dúo Antidoto Group

texts.es:
DUO ANTIDOTO
ESTE DUO LO FORMA DOÑA JUANA ES UNA PERSONA MUY TRABAJADORA Y LUCHADORA, AGRADECE A FAPE Y KIVA EL APOYO QUE LE HAN BRINDADO. ELLA HA SIDO MUY RESPONSABLE Y PUNTUAL EN SUS PAGOS INCLUSO EN LA MAYORIA DE SUS PAGOS HAN HECHO SUS DEPOSITOS ANTES DE LA FECHA. ELLAS SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE ANIMALES DE CORRAL COMO POLLOS, GALLINAS, Y GANADO VACUNO, Y COMO TRABAJO SECUNDARIO SE DEDICA A BORDADOS Y TEJIDOS TIPICOS. SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE MARRANOS, POLLOS, CONCENTRADO Y TELAS PARA BORDAR Y TEJER Y ASI TAMBIEN HILOS DE DIFERENTES COLORES.
texts.en:
“Antídoto” (Antidote) Duo

Juana is a member of this duo.  She’s a very hardworking, tenacious woman who thanks FAPE and KIVA for the support provided.  She’s been very responsible and punctual with her payments, as a matter of fact; she’s made most of them ahead of time.  She works raising barnyard animals like chicks, chickens and cattle and in a secondary line of work also embroiders traditional fabric.  She’s requesting the loan to buy pigs, chicks, animal feed concentrate and fabric to embroider and knit as well as thread in various colors.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens, animal feed as well as fabric and thread.

loans.name: Mkdam

texts.en:
Mkdam is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married, and a father of three children. He is the only provider for the family.

Mkdam has a small shop for selling and repairing mobile phones. He established his business in 2005 and now he has one employee. He built up good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a loan of $2,400 loan to pay the yearly rent for his shop. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the yearly rent for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Zohran

texts.en:
Ms Zohran is 40 years old, married and a mother of six children.  For the past 20 years, Zohran has been running a business selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only breadwinner at that point in time. With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffalo and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. 

Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo

loans.name: Age

texts.en:
Age is 57 years old and has three children. For the past 20 years, Age and her husband Preng, who are in the photograph, have been running a beekeeping and honey production business that has turned out to be profitable.
 
While being interviewed, Age claimed laughing that she does it all; her husband only helps a little. They have been able to establish a good clientele in their region and that has been growing rapidly.

Age is planning to grow the business soon and to do that; she needs to invest 100,000 Albanian Lek to purchase more beehives.

loans.use: To purchase more beehives

loans.name: John

texts.en: John intends to use this loan to purchase general merchandise, such as salt and soap, to sell. He is a hardworking, married man with five children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. The good father that he is, he has dreams of educating his children up to the University level. He has set up sustainable income generating activities so as to secure their future. Price fluctuation and high rental fees affect his business while his dreams are to trade in wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase general merchandise, such as salt and soap, to sell.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a 53-year-old married man with ten children. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

Five years ago, he decided to set up a bar. His business is located on a busy street, thus attracting many customers. With the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and venture into the produce business, which has turned out to be very lucrative. Price fluctuation and high license fees affect his business. 

Christopher intends to use the loan to buy produce such as maize and beans to sell. His dream is to own a food store and expand his bar.

loans.use: to buy produce such as maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Liznarda

texts.es:
Liznarda, de 59 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y dinámica.  Convive  con  Marco quien se dedica al comercio y es padre sus hijos.  Vive en compañía de su conviviente, y su hija  de 33 años de edad a quien quiere mucho. Habitando cómodamente su propia casa que compró mutuamente con su conviviente. La actividad que realiza Liznarda es la venta de comidas diversas, como pollo frito, guiso de pollo, arroz con pollo, entre otros. Para eso cuenta con 1 refrigeradora que es su material de apoyo en su trabajo.  Esta actividad  lo realiza en su domicilio donde tiene un local en el interior de su vivienda, desde este lugar atiende a sus clientes muy amablemente. 
Lleva dedicándose a éste negocio más de 10 años, siendo muy conocida por la zona y hasta el momento  cuenta  con el apoyo ocasional de su pareja para la atención al público.  
Considera rentable a su negocio pues ésta acostumbrada a esa actividad y le genera buenas ganancias que le permiten solventar los gastos de su hogar y la apoyar en la educación de sus nietos. Por lo contrario, antes de iniciar con ésta actividad, el ingreso económico de  su conviviente no les alcanzaba para pagar y solventar todos los gastos de su hogar. Pero ahora, viendo los buenos resultados,  tiene planes de abrir ampliar su local comercial para un mejor atención al público en general. Por tanto éste será el préstamo numero 02 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta con la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Además de sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues los considera ser personas amables y responsables. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de víveres y productos de primera nesecidad en mayor volumen al precio por mayor, para así tener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Liznarda, 59, is a hardworking, enterprising woman in addition to being cheerful and dynamic.  She lives with Marco who is a merchant and the father of their children.  She lives with her spouse and her 33-year-old daughter who she loves very much.  She lives comfortably in her own house that she and her spouse bought together.  Liznarda’s activity is selling various food items like fried chicken, chicken stew, and rice with chicken, among others.  To do so, she has a refrigerator that’s her main support tool at work.  She works from home where she has space inside from which she very graciously tends to her customers.  She’s been in this business more than 10 years and is very well-known in the zone.  To date, her spouse sometimes helps her with customer service.

She considers her business to be profitable because she’s used to it and it generates good profits that make it possible for her to cover household expenses and help pay for her grandchildren’s schooling.  On the other hand, before starting this activity her spouse’s income was insufficient to cover all household expenses.  But now, seeing the good results she’s having she’s planning to expand her commercial site to provide better service to customers in general.

Because of this, this will be MFP loan #2.  She feels happy for the opportunity of having a line of credit available to advance in her business.  She feels good too in her communal bank because she considers them to be responsible, kind people.  She will use the requested 2,000 new soles to buy foodstuffs and basic staples in large amounts and at wholesale prices in order to have a wider profit margin.

loans.use: to buy food and basic staples at wholesale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 41-year-old hardworking man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a teacher by profession, and he was inspired into service by his love for young people.

With his salary savings, Charles bought a motorcycle that he hires out to a driver who remits 80% of the daily income. The business has proved to be very lucrative. High fuel prices and mechanical breakdowns affect his profits. His desire is to own at least five motorcycles. 

Charles intends to use the loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan  de 51 años de edad, originario de Estelí, padre de 7 hijos mayores de edad, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la carpintería desde hace mas de 3 años. Inicio trabajando desde muy joven ayudándoles a otras personas en la carpinteria, el cual fue adquiriendo experiencia en el trabajo, luego con el tiempo  decidió  emprender su  negocio con capital propio, este ha sido su primer negocio, el cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, sus expectativas es ampliar el local para incrementar sus ventas.
El esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar madera.Toda la materia prima  que necesita para la elaboración de sus muebles como mesa, ropero, sillas, gabinetes, etc. ya que el estima que este préstamo le ayudaría a comprar mas madera por mayor, sus planes futuros es establecer un taller de carpintería y contratar empleados que le ayuden en su negocio, su meta próxima es cancelar el crédito para luego volver a solicitar otro.
texts.en:
Juan, 51 years old, is originally from Estelí. He is the father of 7 adult children and a businessman. He has made a living through carpentry for over three years. He began working from a very young age by helping others with carpentry, gaining experience on the job. Eventually, he decided to launch his business with his own capital. This has been his first business. He says that with the support of his wife, his expectations are to improve his establishment to increase his sales.

He is requesting the funding to buy wood, all of the raw material needed for the production of his furniture like tables, wardrobes, seats, cabinets, etc., since he estimates that this loan would help him to buy more wood wholesale. His future plans are to establish a carpentry workshop and hire employees that help him with his business. His next goal is to cancel the loan to be able to request another soon.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame is married to a farmer and has two children. They live together at Dabir near Elmina. 

Maame sells vegetables like onions, and she has done this for two years.  She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their home. 

Maame will use her loan to purchase a variety of vegetables like onions, peppers, tomatoes and others to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables like onions, peppers, tomatoes and others to sell.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en: Ms Bashiran is a 36-year-old married woman and mother of six children.  She is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing, and education. She has been making artificial flowers for the past 10 years. She offers various handmade artificial flowers in different colors, which are used in decorating homes and rooms. By this time, she has become famous for providing good quality colorful flowers in her community. She is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her eighth loan cycle and applied for a loan of Rs 20,000. This will help her to purchase raw material including various types of fabrics such as silk and cotton and packs of glue and wires. In this way, she will be able to get an increase in her earnings through her large sales. Her husband is not in good enough physical shape to be employed. She wishes to use part of the profits on her husband’s health.

loans.use: to purchase various types of fabrics such as silk and cotton and packs of glue and wires.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a hard-working entrepreneur who runs a business fish vending in the Philippines. She is borrowing 17000 PHP from NWTF,  Kiva's field partner, so she can purchase more fish to sell in her food stall.

NWTF is relisting Sarah's business profile so that lenders can support her efforts to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Cándida Rosa de 65 años de edad, madre soltera, con hijo de 20 años el cual es independiente. Es una mujer, trabajadora responsable, con ganas de superación personal, el cual desde muy joven ha tenido que trabajar para ganase el sustento de cada día. Ella es originaria del departamento de Chinandega el cual está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  Cándida tiene por actividad económica una librería ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace 20 años que se dedica a dicha actividad. Su rutina es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos de librería a sus clientes. el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio y aprovechar las ventas en este momento que viene la entrada a clases de los niños y jóvenes del país. Con el financiamiento comprar productos de librería como cuadernos, lápices, marcadores, resaltadores, reglas, borradores, lapiceros de colores, pega, papel lustrio. Cándida Rosa agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a las personas de escasos recursos y países pobre para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Cándida Rosa, 65, is a single mother with a son, 20, who's independent.  She's a hardworking and responsible woman who wants to improve herself.  She has had to work to earn a daily living since she was very young.  She's from the department of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country.

Cándida's job is a bookstore located in her home.  She has worked in this business for 20 years.  Her routine is to work some 10 hours a day, selling her bookstore products to her customers.

The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her bookstore, to take advantage of the current sales, with classes starting for the country's children and young people.  With the loan she'll buy bookstore products such as notebooks, pencils, markers, highlighters, rulers, erasers, colored pencils, glue, and glossy paper.

Cándida Rosa is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries so they have a means to a decent job.

loans.use: to stock her bookstore

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Ms Nazia is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last three years. She offers various goods for daily use. Through all her hard work, she has retained regular customers and makes enough to contribute in the family income. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. Nazia is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy stock of rice and flour along with packs of beverages. She then will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her second loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, flour and beverages.

loans.name: Mursal

texts.en:
Mursal, age 35, is a very hardworking and determined man. He is married and raising two children. The agriculture business is the only income in the family.

Because the family lives in a rural area offering the perfect conditions for raising livestock, he decided to continue his father's business and to get involved in animal husbandry. Mursal now raises cattle.

Husbandry is in high demand among the local population, which is a good opportunity for further development of Mursal's business. He is requesting a loan of 1000 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN) to buy cattle and calves.

loans.use: to buy cattle and calves.

loans.name: Lukman

texts.en:
Lukman is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married and has three children. Lukman is the only provider for the family.

Lukman owns a shop for selling and repairing electronic supplies. He established his business in 2007, and now he has one employee. He built a good experience in this field, and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to pay the yearly rent of his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the yearly rent of his shop.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is married and has five children. She has received schooling through the middle school level. 

Efua sells soft drinks in Kufur near Elmina. She has done this for the past 25 years. Her husband is a security guard. Efua uses her income to help support her husband with the family’s expenses. 

Efua will use the loan to purchase more soft drinks of varying kinds for sale at her “spot” (a local beverage store). With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to improve and expand her beverage spot.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks of varying kinds for sale at her "spot" (a local beverage store).

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is divorced and has one child. She has received no formal education. Aba is a fishmonger who sells local, smoked, and fried fish in Kufur near Elmina. Aba has worked as a fishmonger for the past six years. Aba uses her income to support her family. Aba will use the loan to purchase more fish from local fishermen for preparation and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to increase her capital base to buy greater quantities of fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more fish from local fishermen for preparation and sale.

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: La joven Claudia tiene 29 años de edad, estudiante de la carrera de contaduría pública y finanzas, trabaja como contadora en una clínica privada con sus ingresos se ayuda para los gastos universitarios, culminar su profesión es muy importante para ella ya que está un poco retrasada debido a problemas de salud y su mayor deseo es aportar sus conocimientos a la sociedad para brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, por esta razón Claudia solicita apoyo de crédito para poder pagar el curso de titulación al que tiene que ingresar para obtener su titulo.
texts.en: Claudia is 29 years old and is studying for her degree in public accounting and finance.  She works as an accountant in a private clinic, which helps pay for her university expenses.  Finishing her degree is very important to her because she is a little behind due to health problems.  Her greatest wish is to contribute to society with her knowledge and improve her family’s living conditions.  For this reason Claudia is requesting this loan to pay for her final degree course, in which she must enroll in order to obtain her degree.

loans.use: to pay for her final degree course.

loans.name: Alvaro Antonio

texts.es: Álvaro Antonio de  48 anos de edad de la localidad del departamento León, soltero con un hijo de 13 anos. Él tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa nueva. En un lugar especifico de la localidad. Tiene 5 anos de tener el negocio. Álvaro es un hombre que se caracteriza por tener buena solvencia moral de pago.  En los créditos anteriores ha pagado  en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería como: pantalón, camisas, faldas, ropa interior, camisetas, ropa de cama, sandalias, zapatos de niños y adultos. La rutina diaria de Álvaro es trabajar unas 8 horas diarias. Álvaro agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países  pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Álvaro Antonio, 48, is from León Department.  He’s single and has a 13-year-old son.  His economic activity is selling new clothes in a specific local spot.  He’s been in business five years.  Álvaro is a man who is noted for having good payment behavior.  He’s repaid his previous loans on time and as required.  He needs financing to invest in working capital and stock his business.  He will buy merchandise like pants, shirts, skirts, underwear, t-shirts, bed linen, sandals, children’s and adults’ shoes.  His daily routine is to work 8 hours.  He is grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide people of scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have dignified ways of earning a living.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Mouslem

texts.en:
Mouslem is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 21 years old and married with one child. Mouslem is the only provider in the family. 
Mouslem owns a shop for selling spare parts. He established his business in 2005 and now he has two employees. He gained good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a youth loan of $2,000 to renovate his shop and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Erisa

texts.en:
Erisa is 33 years old and has four children.  He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He started a retail shop in order to supplement his carpentry business, which he still operates. His business is located on the main street and attracts many customers. With the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and renovate his house.

Erisa is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy stock such as rice and salt to sell.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as rice and salt to sell.

loans.name: Yamer

texts.en:
Yamer is from Iraq. He is 40 years old, is married, and has four children. Yamer is the only provider for the family.

Yamer has been the owner of a block factory since 2005, and now he has four employees. He built up good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a loan of $2,400 to buy a machine used for cutting stone blocks. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a machine used for cutting stone blocks.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a widow and has two children. She has no formal education. 

Ama sells corn dough in Kufur near Elmina. She has done this for some time now. She uses her income to support her children in their daily needs. 

Ama will use the loan to buy more corn and other supplies needed to make her corn dough. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to improve and develop her dough-making business.

loans.use: to buy more corn and other supplies needed to make her corn dough.

loans.name: Grigol

texts.en: Grigol is 34 years old. He lives with his parents in a small village in Vani district. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese locally in an open market at a good price. Besides, they have a vineyard and a one-hectare piece of agricultural land, where 200 nut trees are grown. Grigol works hard to insure a good harvest. He requested a loan for purchasing a cow. After purchasing an additional cow, they will produce more dairy products and thus their income will increase. With the increased income, they will improve their living conditions. Grigol awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba sells the local dish banku in Kufur near Elmina. Araba has received no formal education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a fisherman. Araba has been selling the local dish banku for 30 years. She is responsible for supporting her husband and children. Her loan will be used to buy more corn and cassava to make banku. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to improve and expand her banku-making enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more corn and cassava to make banku.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is divorced and has four children. She has received no formal education. Theresa sells various local foods at a chop bar stand; such favorites include banku, kenkey, and gari. Theresa’s chop bar is located in Kufur, near Elmina, and she has worked in this business for the past three years. Theresa uses her income to pay for the support of her children. 

Theresa will use the loan to purchase more food supplies, for preparation and sale at her chop bar. With the new profits from her expanded business, Theresa plans to invest back into her business and further expand.

loans.use: to purchase more food supplies, for preparation and sale at her chop bar.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa is married and has five children. She has received no formal education. Adjoa is a fishmonger and sells smoked and fried fish in Kufur, near Elmina. Adjoa has been a fishmonger for the past four years. Her husband works as a carpenter. Adjoa uses her income to help pay for her family's expenses.
