Adjoa will use the loan to buy more more fish from local fishermen, for preparation and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to expand her fish-selling business, to meet the local demand.

loans.use: to buy more fish, for preparation and sale.

loans.name: Blanca Fanny

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer trabajadora con 60 años que a pesar de su edad ha continuado trabajando y buscando el sustento diario sin importar las imposibilidades de salud que por su edad a veces se presentan. Cursó estudios de nivel primario, y el obstáculo más difícil que ha atravesado fue la muerte de su esposo hace algunos años. Tiene 6 hijos adultos que viven de manera independiente, excepto Lilian de 21 años con quien vive en la actualidad en Atuntaqui una ciudad de la provincia de Imbabura en  el norte del Ecuador.  Un lugar que goza de muchos lugares históricos que ofrecer a quienes le visitan además de una deliciosa gastronomía que es la favorita de  muchos en el país. Otra actividad que es muy conocida en este cantón es la textil, pues el diseño de ropa industrial y artesanal se ha convertido en una actividad que aporta al crecimiento sostenido de la ciudad por lo que las prendas elaboradas son preferidas por su diferente calidad y diseños a nivel nacional e internacional. Cuenta con un clima agradable que es seco y templado lo que ayuda mantener sus tierras fértiles y por lo tanto aptas para el cultivo de cereales y legumbres. Por todas estas oportunidades existentes en la ciudad, Atuntaqui es considerado un centro productivo importante para el Ecuador, mérito que no fuese posible sin la fuerza y espíritu emprendedor de sus habitantes que a la vez generan plazas de trabajo para las familias de la Provincia.
Expuesta a inesperadas lluvias y a temperaturas fuertes de sol, Blanca ha mantenido su negocio de venta de ropa casual en un puesto designado en la calle donde varios comerciantes de ropa exhiben su mercadería. Blanca lleva en esta actividad 6 años y en el cual invierte 10 horas cada día desde muy temprano en la mañana hasta que el sol se oculta. Paralelamente a esta actividad, Blanca siempre está pendiente de su casa y los quehaceres que hay en ella y traslada sola la mercadería hasta su lugar de trabajo que aunque son bultos de gran tamaño su deseo de trabajar y sentirse útil la ha llevado a adquirir experiencia en todos estos detalles. A través del tiempo Blanca sabe que cada temporada del año la demanda por cierto tipo de ropa cambia pero que los gustos por la ropa de siempre se mantienen, es por esto que requiere un préstamo para comprar ropa de temporada e incrementar la variedad de ropa que ya tiene, para que sus clientes puedan encontrar lo que buscan y así Blanca pueda generar más ingresos que le permitan cubrir sus necesidades y además mejorar la calidad de vida. Blanca agradece la confianza y agilidad que Fundación Alternativa le ha brindado para la obtención del crédito y agradece a las personas que a través de Kiva formarán parte de su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Blanca, 60, is a hardworking woman who despite her age continues to work seeking daily support ignoring the health issues her age sometimes presents.  She attended elementary school and the hardest challenge she’s had to face was the death of her husband some years ago.  She has six adult children who live on their own, except Lilian, 21, who currently lives with her in Atuntaqui, a city in Imbabura Province in northern Ecuador.  This is a place that has many historic sites of interest to those who visit in addition to a delicious cuisine that is the favorite of many in the country.  Another well-known activity in this canton is textiles for industrial and artisanal clothes making has become an activity that contributes to the city’s support since the clothes manufactured here are preferred for their quality and design both nationally and internationally.  It has a pleasant climate that’s dry and mild which helps keep the soil fertile and apt for growing cereals and legumes.  Because of all these opportunities available in the city, Atuntaqui is considered to be an important productive center in Ecuador, a distinction that would not have been possible without the strength and enterprising spirit of its residents who at the same time generate employment for families in the Province.

Exposed to sudden rainfalls and high temperatures under the sun, Blanca has kept her casual clothing business open in an assigned stand on the street where several clothes merchants display their merchandise.  Blanca has been in this activity for six years and she puts in ten-hour work days starting very early in the morning and going until sunset.  Blanca is also always watchful of her home and the chores that must be done there; she also transports the merchandise by herself to her work space even though the bundles are very large.  She wants to work and feel useful and this has led her to gain experience in all these details.

As time has passed, Blanca has learned that each season of the year demands a certain type of clothes b but that as styles change, good taste does not which is why she needs a loan to buy seasonal clothes to increase the variety of clothes she has so that her customers will find what they are looking for and Blanca will generate higher income to cover her needs and improve her quality of life.  Blanca is grateful for the trust and quickness with which Fundación Alternativa has provided her loan and thanks people who through Kiva are part of her growth.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena sells cassava, bananas, and plantains at Besease, near Elmina. She has been selling this for four years. Abena is married to a farmer and has five dependents. Abena uses her income to assist her husband, to provide for their family. 

She will use her loan to purchase more cassava, bananas and plantains for sale. With the new profit, Abena plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more cassava, bananas and plantains for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabric for making sportswear

loans.name: Mariipa

texts.ru: Марийпе 46 лет. Марийпа имеет среднее образование, по характеру очень доброжелательная и ответственная. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Марийпа занимается животноводством. Начатое в 2000 году с 10,000 сом KGS хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 6,000-7,000 сом (KGS) в каждый месяц. На данный момент в хозяйстве Марипы 1 дойные коровы, 40 голов овец и 3 лошади. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Марипа обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы Марипа планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Mariipa is 46 years old. She has secondary education. She is a very friendly and responsible person by nature. As the main source of income for her family, Mariipa raises livestock. Her farm, launched in 2000 with 10,000 KGS, now brings in around 6,000-7,000 KGS per month. At present Mariipa’s farm includes one dairy cow, 40 sheep and three horses. In order to develop her business further, Mariipa turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 120,000 KGS in order to buy cattle for fattening and resale. Maiipa plans to invest her earnings into a further increase of animal headcount.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Farouk

texts.en:
Farouk is a 31-year-old single man. He has worked in the scrap-trading business for 15 years until he opened his own shop. Farouk is experienced in this industry and has earned a wide client base including his friends, neighbors and even tourists in the region. The parts he sells are of good quality while he maintains competitive and reasonable pricing.

Farouk is quite ambitious and aims at opening another branch of his business. He is applying for his first loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, which he will invest in buying some metal scraps and vehicle parts. By increasing his product offerings, Farouk’s sales and revenues will rise, allowing him to save more money for his business expansion.

loans.use: to buy some metal scraps and vehicle parts

loans.name: Jaber

texts.en:
Jaber is from Iraq. He is 50 years old, married and has seven children. He is the only provider for the family. Jaber owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2011. He has built good experience in this field, and he is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Jaber is requesting a loan of $1,500 to buy a new big generator for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new big generator for his shop

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.ru: Хосият опытная портниха и создает шедевры таджикских национальных платьев. Она молодая и энергичная. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 3 года назад она начала свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Она шьет платья в своем доме. Благодаря  хорошему сервису, она обладает широким кругом клиентов. Ее клиенты женщины со вкусом и очень трудно их удовлетворять, но Хосият с легкостью справляется с их капризами. Она справляется со всеми семейными расходами сама, так как ее муж без работник. Она сказала мужу, чтобы он начал работать, так как ей одной тяжело справляться с расходами. Ее муж попросил ее купить билет в Ленинград, где он имеет друзей и его друзья помогут ему найти работу. Хосият не имеет денег и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму  2500 сомони для покупки авиабилета для своего мужа. Она надеется на вас и вашу доброту.
texts.en: Hosiyat is an experienced seamstress who creates masterpieces of Tajik national dress. She is young and energetic. She is married and has one child. In order to provide the family with needed income, three years ago she started her business sewing women's clothes. She sews clothes at home. Thanks to her excellent service she has a wide range of clients. Her clients are women with taste, and it is very difficult to satisfy them, but Hosiyat easily copes with their whims. She handles all of the family expenses herself, since her husband is unemployed. She told her husband that he must find work, since it is hard for her to support the family by herself.  Her husband asked her to buy a ticket to Leningrad where he has friends who can help him find a job. Hosiyat has no money, so she is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni to buy a ticket for her husband. She is counting on you and your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a plane ticket so that her husband can work abroad.

loans.name: Nena

texts.es:
Nena, de 57 años es una mujer valiente y emprendedora.  Tiene 06 hijos a quienes brinda educación y crianza hasta que ellos puedan ser independientes.  Vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposo Emilio de 56 años quien es docente  quien le brinda  las fuerzas para seguir  trabajando mucho y  se apoyan mutuamente  para tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Nena consiste en la venta de ropas usadas de toda variedad para damas, caballeros y niños para toda ocasión. Toda su mercadería la compra en el centro comercial de  su ciudad por fardos y lo lleva a vender por las rivera del río en los caseríos y zonas alejadas. ,
Se inició con esta actividad por la idea e iniciativa de su esposo quien es docente por un caserío en la rivera del río a donde lleva su mercadería, viendo que es fácil y rentable decidió continuar en ésta actividad y hasta el momento cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo.  
Considera  rentable su negocio por tener variedad de clientes y esto le genera muchos ingresos económicos. 
Aunque su trabajo a veces le resulta un poco pesado por los viajes que realiza y  porque tiene que cargar a veces su mercadería ella sola,  pero sabe que debe que esforzarse al máximo para poder tener mejores ganancias.  A pesar que vende mucho, a ella le gustaría  tener mayores ganancias y vender en mayor volumen. Por eso,  desea seguir trabajando y  hacer crecer su negocio. Por tanto éste será el préstamo  número 13  con MFP, por ello cuenta de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, ella por su parte se compromete una vez más a cumplir con sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Està muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son personas muy amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará mayor cantidad de ropas usadas en fardos buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen, de esa manera desea obtener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Nena, 57, is a brave, hardworking woman.  She has six children she wants to provide schooling for and raise until they can be independent.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Emilio, 56, who is a teacher and provides her with the strength to continue working hard; they support each other to have a better quality of life.  Nena’s work consists in selling used clothes of all types and for all occasions for women, men and children.  She buys all her merchandise by the bundle in a shopping center in her city and then takes it to be sold in settlements along the river banks and in distant zones.

She started in this activity thanks to her husband’s idea and initiative since he’s a teacher in a settlement along the river bank where she takes her merchandise.  Seeing that it’s easy and profitable she decided to continue with this activity and to date gets help from her husband.   She considers the business to be profitable because she has several customers and this generates good income.

Although her work is sometimes somewhat heavy due to the trips she must make and because she has to carry the merchandise by herself, she knows that by exerting the maximum effort she will earn the higher profits.  Despite selling much, she’d like to earn higher profits and sell in larger amounts which is why she wants to continue working and making her business grow.  

Therefore, this will be MFP loan #13 and she can count on it to continue towards her objectives.  On her part, she commits once again to make her payments on time like she’s done previously.  She’s very happy to belong to her communal bank because all the members are very kind, mutually supportive people.   She will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy larger amounts of used clothes by the bundle seeking the lowest prices for volume purchases so that her profit margin will increase.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of used clothes.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 30 years old, married and has been blessed with one child. He runs a spare parts shop and has been in business for the past six years. He is very hardworking and friendly. 

Since he became a client of Faulu, he has learnt how to save his money. Someday he hopes to expand his business and open another spare parts shop. 

John requires a loan of 105,300 KES to buy brake pads and vehicle batteries.

loans.use: to buy brake pads and vehicle batteries.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.es:
Xenia, de 21 años de edad., es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, además de amable y jovial. Es soltera y sin hijos.  Vive en compañía de sus  padres y su hermano a los quiere mucho instalados en una casa alquilada.
El negocio que realiza Xenia  es la venta de comidas como tallarines, arroz chaufa, pollos fritos y refrescos helados. Para eso instala una mesa y sillas en el frotis de su vivienda al medio día donde brinda almuerzos. Iniciándose con el apoyo de un capital de trabajo que le brindó su madre hace 03 años, trabaja con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logrando ganarse una regular clientela a la que atiende amablemente. Lleva realizando esta actividad a medio tiempo con la ayuda de su madre en la atención al público. 
Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja y cada día sus clientes aumentan. 
Le gusta  su actividad por brindarle un oficio y sentirse una mujer productiva, eso  la distrae y relaja, además con el ingreso económico que le genera puede apoyar a su familia y pagarse sus estudios universitarios por las noches. Por otro, no le gusta su actividad la calentura de la cocina a carbón que le calienta el cuerpo y le perjudica la salud, pero eso no la desanima. Por eso tiene planes de continuar y ampliar su negocio. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 04  con la institución MFP, para ello cuenta con su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se siente bien con su banco comunal pues  considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado de 1800 nuevos soles, comprará utensilios para la cocina como platos, ollas, sartenes, también ingredientes para la preparación de alimentos al por mayor como fideos, arroz, aceites y otros. Buscando precios bajos por sus compras en cantidad para obtener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Xenia, 21, is a hardworking, dynamic woman in addition to being kind and jovial.  She’s single with no children.  She lives in a rented house with her parents and brother who she loves very much.  Xenia’s business is selling food like noodles, Chinese-style rice, and fried chicken and cold beverages.  To do so, she sets up a table and chairs in her front yard at noon to sell lunch.  She started out with working capital her mother gave her three years ago.  She works with much effort and dedication and has won over a regular clientele that she tends to graciously.  She’s been doing this work half-time with her mother helping her tend to the public.  She considers the business to be profitable because of the good profits it nets and because her customers are increasing daily.

She likes her activity because it gives her an occupation and she feels like a productive woman; this relaxes and distracts her.  Also, she’s able to use income generated to help out her family and pay for her university studies at night.  On the other hand, she doesn’t much like the hot charcoal stove that heats her body and damages her health but this does not discourage her.  Therefore, she has plans to continue and to expand the business.  This will then be her MFP loan #4 and she’s hoping for your collaboration to continue towards her objectives.  On the other hand, she feels good in her communal bank because she considers the members to be responsible people.

She will use the requested 1,800 new soles to buy kitchen utensils like plates, pots and pans and also to buy food preparation ingredients like noodles, rice, oil and others at wholesale seeking out the lowest prices for volume purchases so her profit margin will be larger.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en:
Ghassan is a 48-year-old married man and a father of five children. He has owned a convenience store since 2003, selling various products from foodstuffs to candies, beverages and detergents. 

Ghassan has faced financial hardships due to lack of capital, but with his determination and the support of his wife who helps him in the store, he was able to maintain his business.

Today, Ghassan is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, in order to expand his stock of products, mainly of foodstuffs and candies. This is his third cycle, and he has been quite satisfied with the loans’ contribution in refreshing his business. 

In the future, he wishes to enlarge his store and increase his offerings.

loans.use: to expand his stock of products, mainly of foodstuffs and candies.

loans.name: Las Pioneras Group

texts.es: Este es el Grupo las “Las Pioneras” que conforman 07 mujeres emprendedoras que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio que pasan al ciclo 21. Jacinta tiene 50 años, casada con 01 hijo en etapa escolar. Jacinta tiene su carrito sanguchero en la cual vende salchipapa, hamburguesa, pollito broster y cuenta con clientes fidelizados. Con el crédito que solicito Jacinta comprara pollo, papa, aceite y platos descartables. Una de la metas de Jacinta es de implementar más en su negocio. Jacinta está muy contenta con este préstamo y agradece aEdaprospo y a Kiva. Jacinta se encuentra en la parte de adelante es la primera del lado izquierdo, viste polo blanco con falda negra.
texts.en:
This is the “Las Pioneras” [The Pioneers] Group.  It is made up of seven women entrepreneurs who work at various business activities and are currently in their 21st loan cycle.

Jacinta is 50 years old, married and has one son who is in school.  Jacinta has a sandwich cart from which she sells fried potatoes with hot dogs, hamburgers and fried chicken to her loyal customers.

With this loan Jacinta will buy chicken, potatoes, oil and disposable plates.  One of her goals is to expand her business.  Jacinta is very happy with this loan and is thankful to Edaprospo and Kiva.  Jacinta is in the front part of the photo and is the first from the left wearing a white polo and black skirt.

loans.use: to buy chicken, potatoes, oil and disposable plates.

loans.name: Kumushai

texts.ru: Кумушай 42 года, мать 3 детей. Кумушай в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 1999 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Начатый с суммы 20,000 KGS бизнес благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости Кумушай, на сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом в месяц от перепродажи скота на рынке. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кумушай обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков и овец на откорм и перепродажу. Доходы от кредита Кумушай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Kumushai is 42 years old and the mother of three children. Kumushai provides the main source of income for her family. Since 1999, she has worked in animal husbandry. She launched her business with 20,000 KGS, and through hard work and perseverance Kumushai now brings in about 5,000 som per month from reselling cattle. In order to further expand her business, Kumushai approached Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 65,000 som (KGS) to buy calves and sheep to fatten and sell. Kumushai plans to invest her profit from the loan back into her business.

loans.use: buy calves and sheep to fatten and sell

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гульнаре 48 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. Гульнара в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается торговлей сельхозпродуктов, начав этот бизнес с суммы 10,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Гульнары в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется сельхозпродукты около 70,000 KGS; картошка,капуста, морковь. Продажа сельхозпродукции приносит около 10,000 сом в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульнара обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку продуктов для увеличения выручки. Доходы от кредита Гульнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее развития бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность оплаты за обучение детей.
texts.en: Gulnara is 48 years old, married, and has three children. Gulnara is a major source of income for her family. She sells produce. She started this business with 10,000 KGS. Thanks to Gulnara's hard work, she now has produce worth about 70,000 KGS: potatoes, cabbage, and carrots. She earns about 10,000 som per month selling produce. In order to further develop her business, Gulnara approached Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy more goods, which will increase her revenue.  Gulnara plans to invest income from the loan back into her business, as well as paying for her children's education.

loans.use: purchase more goods and increase sales

loans.name: Abed Alamir

texts.en:
Abed is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has two children. He is the only provider of the family.

Abed owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2007, and now he has an employee. He has built good experience in this field, and he is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a loan of $2,400 to pay the annual rent on his grocery store as well as to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent on his grocery store as well as to increase his inventory

loans.name: Nabiha

texts.en:
Nabiha is a 34-year-old, married woman and a mother of four children. She opened a shoe store in 2004 and, since then, she has been supporting her husband in their household expenses. With consecutive loans from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, Nabiha succeeded in enhancing the quality of her products and increasing the visibility of her store.

Today, Nabiha is applying for a fifth loan; she will use the money to buy more shoes and diversify her offerings to include toys. This will allow her to generate more revenues and further secure her business continuity.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and diversify her offerings to include toys.

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is a 49-year-old, married man, and the father of five children. He has owned his grocery store for 12 years. He is distinguished by his honesty, among other vendors in the region. Khodor is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, to help him buy a pickup truck. This will facilitate his trips to the wholesalers and considerably reduce his transportation expenses.  

Khodor is ambitious and positive about the future of his business. He aims to expand his store further, to offer a bigger variety of fruits and vegetables to best serve his customers’ needs.

loans.use: to buy a pickup truck, to reduce the expense of transporting goods from wholesalers' premises to his grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Dúo El Rosario De Sumpango Group

texts.es: Dúo El Rosario de Sumpango. este grupo esta conformado por la señora Lidia Cristina, quien es de Sumpango Sacatepéquez, ella tiene 39 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de sandalias y venta de desinfectantes, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 9 años, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en sandalias y desinfectantes, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito y asi ella pueda luchar para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
This is the group "Dúo El Rosario de Sumpango".  This group is formed in part by Lidia Cristina, who is originally from Sumpango Sacatepéquez.  She is thirty-nine years old, is married, and has three children.  She makes a living selling sandals and disinfectants.  She has been working in this position for nine years.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy more merchandise (sandals and disinfectants).  She hopes that individuals can help her with the loan, which would allow her to continue fighting to move forward with her business.

loans.use: to buy sandals and disinfectants to sell.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.es: El Sr. Avelino  tiene 60 años y tiene dos hijos que tienen la edad de 7 y 11  años, el se dedica a la venta  de madera y producción de carbón desde hace ya varios años esta actividad lo aprendió de su padre quien también se dedicaba a la producción de carbón, el tiene su parcela que se encuentra ubicado en la localidad de Rio Seco, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Avelino  utilizara  este préstamo  para  la compra de moto sierras para cortar  madera para la producción de carbón, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de estas herramientas de trabajo, ya que esto no le permite cortar en mayor cantidad, El Sr. Avelino  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia, ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia, por este motivo se siente feliz y agradecido con la institucion con el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Avelino is 60 years old and has two children who are 7 and 11 years old. For many years, he has earned his living selling wood and producing charcoal. He learned this business from his father, who also made his living producing charcoal. He has a plot of land located in Rio Seco. This loan is his first within the institution. 

Avelino will use this loan to purchase chainsaws for cutting wood to produce charcoal. The reason he is requesting this loan is that he lacks capital for buying these tools of his trade, which prevents him from cutting in larger quantities. 

Avelino faces challenges in his business, like rising out of poverty. He is going to use the loan to improve his and his family's quality of life, since this is the only activity that allows him to provide for himself and his family. For that reason, he feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy chainsaws for charcoal production.

loans.name: Brigido Bismark

texts.es: Brigido de 38 años de edad  tiene una licenciatura en administración de empresas, casado su  esposa es ama de casa tienen un hijo de 4 años quien estudia y espera que cuando crezca trabaje con él en su microempresa de transporte por el cual está solicitando apoyo de crédito por primera vez para comprar 7 llantas para su camión ya que este es su principal medio de trabajo el cual alquila para distribuir productos y también realiza traslado de ganados, sus deseos a futuros es comprar más camiones para seguir creciendo en su negocio y así apoyar más a su familia.
texts.en: Brigido, 38, has a Business Administration degree.  He’s married and his wife is a housewife; they have a 4-year-old son who attends school and he hopes that when he grows up he’ll work with him in his transportation micro firm.  He’s asking for his first loan to buy 7 tires for his truck because it’s his main work tool; he leases it out to deliver products and also to transport cattle.  His future wish is to buy more trucks to continue growing in business and better support his family this way.

loans.use: to buy 7 truck tires.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: María, de 70 años de edad, de oficio comerciante atiende una pulpería, casada, madre de 2 hijos originaria de la ciudad de León, lleva 10 años trabajando en el sector comercio. La temporada escolar se acerca y necesita surtir su negocio con nuevos productos alimenticios así como productos para la escuela. Por esa razón está solicitando el financiamiento para la compra de cuadernos, lapiceros, lápiz de colores, borradores, marcadores, productos de limpieza, granos básicos y enlatados para vender en su pulpería.   Su objetivo es ir agregando más productos que son muy demandados por sus clientes  y lograr convertir su pulpería en una miscelánea.
texts.en: María, 70, is a grocery merchant.  She’s married and the mother of two children.  She’s from the city of León.  She’s been working in commerce for ten years.  The school term is approaching and she needs to stock her store with new food items as well as with school supplies.  Because of this, she’s asking for a loan to buy notebooks, pencils, colored pencils, erasers, markers, cleaning supplies, basic grains and canned gods to sell in her store.  Her goal is to gradually add more products that have high customer demand and convert her grocery store into a variety store.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, cleaning supplies, basic grains and canned goods.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora María del Rosario de 38 años de edad se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo de belleza y utensilio de cocina , hace 17 años inicio con la ayuda de una señora  quien l ofreció catálogos de esa forma ella empezó a tener sus primeros clientes quienes fueron  sus amigas y con la ayuda de las recomendaciones que ellas le hacían  logro tener más ganancias de esa  forma logro inscribirse a otras casas de ventas por catalogo, hace  seis meses  inicio con la venta de productos de utensilios de cocina  por  catálogos que le ha ido bien  y a generado más aumentos a sus ventas  y con la ayuda de otras señoras que le ayudan a vender  logro tener su propio  negocio en su domicilio sin descuidar sus ventas de ambulante en  san Pedro Sacatepequez su deseo es seguir creciendo en sus ventas para tener variedad de productos  y  poder comprar una vitrina para colocar sus productos  y así mismo ser un apoyo para su  familia tiene  4 hijos que estudian  en la escuela de la localidad. solicita este credito para la compra de productos por
catalogo de belleza y utensilio de cocina
texts.en:
María del Rosario, 38, sells beauty products and kitchen utensils via catalog.  She started 17 years go with help from a lady that offered her catalogs and this is how she started to get her first customers who were her girlfriends.  With help from recommendations from them she earned higher profits and was able to sign up with more catalog sales firms.  

Six months ago she started also selling kitchen utensils via catalog and she’s done very well generating higher sales with the help of other ladies that help her sell.  She’s now succeeded in opening her own business at home while still attending to her sales from place to place in San Pedro Sacatepéquez.  

Her wish is to continue increasing sales to have a variety of products and to be able to buy a display case for her merchandise to be a source of support for her family since she has four children attending a local school.  She’s requesting this loan to buy beauty products and kitchen utensils via catalog.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Ilia

texts.en: Ilia is 45 years old. He is single and lives alone in the village of Gurjaani. The source of income for Ilia is his vineyard. He does all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good quality harvest. The harvested grapes are sold locally. So, he has only seasonal income and he has requested loans from local financial institutions several times to start a trading business, but without any success. His loan requests were always rejected because of lack of experience in the new business, which is usually demanded by local credit providers. His loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program provides credit to the rural poor who do not have access to it, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. Ilia owns a building and plans to set up a grocery store there. With the loan, he will purchase stock for the store. Selling grocery products will positively impact him. This new business initiative will double Ilia’s income and enable him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his grocery store

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 22-year-old, single man, who opened a convenience store nearly two years ago. He has suffered from lack of capital, so he hasn’t been able to cater to the large needs of customers in the area. In spite of this, Walid has a considerable client base, due to his integrity and honesty in trade.

In order to obtain cash and increase his stock of foodstuffs and detergents, Walid is applying for a Youth Loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua. With the capital, he will be able to support his customers’ demands, and further expand and succeed in his business.

loans.use: increase his stock of foodstuffs and detergents

loans.name: Davrigul

texts.ru: Трудящийся человек для образования молодежи, находится в финансовом не достатке. Ее зовут Давригул. Ей 46 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 6 детей. Ее муж разнорабочий и предоставляет услуги как уходом сада и огорода,  уборка домов и т.п. Давригул более 25 лет работает учительницей в средней школе. Она является учителем алгебры и геометрии и имеет хорошее знание. Ее ученики очень любят и уважают ее. Скоро одна из ее дочерей, которую зовут Мухаббат, выходит замуж и Давригул не имеет денег для проведения свадебно мероприятия ее дочери, так как ее зарплата маленькая и муж тоже не имеет сбережения. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 800 долларов США для проведения свадебного мероприятия. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: A working woman who educates young people is lacking financial resources.  Her name is Davrigul.  She is 46 years old.  She is married and is raising 6 children.  Her husband is a laborer and offers such services as taking care of livestock and gardens, house cleaning, etc.  Davrigul has been working as a high school teacher for over 25 years.  She teaches Algebra and Geometry and has good knowledge. Her students love and respect her very much.  Soon one of her daughters whose name is Mukhabbat will get married and Davrigul does not have money for the wedding of her daughter since her salary is small and her husband also does not have savings.  She is asking for a loan of 800 US dollars for the wedding.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to have a wedding party for her daughter

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 28-year-old, married man, who has been working in construction for six years. He has been expanding his business since then. In 2011 he began sharing a shop, where he stores his tools and materials. Ali works on a freelance basis, contracting various building jobs while employing two construction workers to assist him.

Due to his good borrowing experience with Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, Ali is applying for another Youth Loan, which he will invest in buying wood and iron pillars. Ali has a wide experience in his field, and he is determined to expand his business into an independent, fully-fledged construction contracting workshop.

loans.use: to invest in buying wood and iron pillars, which he will use in his construction contracting business.

loans.name: Neli

texts.en: Neli lives in Gurjaani District. She is 43 years old, married and lives with her husband and two children (7 and 11 years old). The source of income for the family is the agricultural business. They have a small vineyard and a plot of land where strawberries and peaches are grown. Neli sells the harvested products locally. Neli and her husband decided to start a`new business as their existing income wasn't enough for the family. Her loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provisions of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. With the loan, Neli will purchase a car and her husband will serve the local people as a taxi driver. They also will use the car in trading and save the transportation costs of their harvested products. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve the living conditions of the family. Along with the above-mentioned, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her husband to use as a taxi

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 33-year-old single man who has been working in the hooka business for six years. He also has a pool table and almost all of his customers are attracted to his shop because they enjoy both activities he provides.

His business is based on entertaining his customers. That's why he is applying for his present loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase his Hookas to expand his business and to reply better to the increased number of customers he is willing to have.

Walid is working hard to keep on expanding his business as much as he can, to open a wider entertaining place in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more hookas

loans.name: Jubilee Tukore Group

texts.en:
Jubilee Tukore Group is located in the center of Ibanda Town. The group is mainly comprised of women whose major activity is trade and agriculture. They fall into several family demographic categories, including divorced, widowed, single mothers, and a few who are married.

Rose is a single mother of three children. She lost her husband, three years back, in a car accident. Her three children are all in school. In addition, she looks after her two nephews, who are also orphans. 

Rose is mainly an agriculturalist who grows crops and raises goats and sheep. She supplements the farming with income from a small restaurant, with capital of UGX 100,000. She resorted to farming in 2010, after losing her husband, so that she could feed her children and take them to school.

She will use the loan to buy goats and sheep to sell, to buy more materials to use in her restaurant, and to use some of the money to pay tuition for her children. Her customers are mainly neighbors and passersby. 

Rose's main challenge is theft around the village. Sometimes thieves steal her goats and sheep after she has invested her money in them, especially the loan money, and this affects her cash flow. Sometimes she or her children fall sick and, on such days, she is unable to till her land. 

Despite all the challenges, Rose is very hard-working and determined to change her future, along with that of the children, by giving them a good education.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Chimaltecas Group

texts.es:
DUO CHIMALTECAS
ESTE DUO LO INTEGRAN LAS SEÑORA BLANCA CAROLINA ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA DE DAMA EN DONDE VIVE, ELLA DISTRIBUYE A SUS CLIENTES POR LA CALIDAD DE PRODUCTO QUE VENDEN LA SEÑORA BLANCA ES CASADA Y ESTA ESPERANDO A SU BEBE, A QUIEN QUIERE DARLE LO MEJOR SUEÑA CON PODER INCREMENTAR SUS VENTAS Y HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO Y TENER UNA CALIDA DE VIDA Y SALIR ADELANTE TRABAJANDO Y VENDIENDO SU PRODUCTOS; ELLA AGRADECE A FAPE Y A DIOS POR APOYARLAS CON LOS PEQUEÑOS CREDITOS.
texts.en:
Duo Chimaltecas
Blanca Carolina is a member of this duo. She makes a living through the sales of women’s clothing. She distributes her goods to her customers where they live because of the quality of products that they sell. 

Blanca is married and is expecting a baby to whom she wants to give the best. She dreams of being able to increase her sales and make her business grow to have a good quality of life and to come out ahead working and selling her products. She is thankful to FAPE and to God for supporting them with their small loans.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing to sell.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es: María Teresa de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida; ella se dedica a la compra y venta de billetes de lotería, tiene varios años de tener el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, comercia de forma ambulante y es muy conocida en las localidades que visita, eso le ha ayudado a hacerse de mucha clientela pues  es una persona confiable al igual que los billetes que vende son a precios accesibles y además el servicio es excelente; María es una mujer emprendedora, visionaria siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que la lleven al éxito, quiere hacer crecer el negocio y planea invertir en este nuevo año que comienza, pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar billetes de lotería por mayor. María Teresa tiene experiencia crediticia y muy buenas recomendaciones, tiene la certeza que podrá saldar su financiamiento y a la vez podrá darle a su familia la calidad de vida que se merece.
texts.en:
María Teresa, 43, lives with her life companion.  She buys and sells lottery tickets.  She’s been in business several years and has gained much experience that makes it possible for her to earn the best profits.  She sells from place to place and is very well-known in the communities she visits; this has helped her acquire a large clientele because she’s a trustworthy person and the tickets she sells are affordable and service is excellent.

María is an enterprising, forward-looking person who is always on the lookout for new opportunities that will lead to success.  She wants to make her business grow and plans to invest in this new year that’s beginning but needs capital which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy lottery tickets at wholesale.  María Teresa has good credit history and very good recommendations; she’s sure that she can repay the loan while at the same time being able to provide her family with the quality of life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets.

loans.name: Elena Hermelinda

texts.es: Elena Hermelinda de cuarenta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su hijo en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos en variedad, tiene  varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener siempre las ganancias esperadas, su negocio se ubica en un lugar que califico como excelente para  sus actividades comerciales,  ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que vende Elena es de muy buena calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es inigualable; es una mujer decidida con muchas ganas de salir adelante, le gusta aprovechar las oportunidades que se le presentan porque sabe que solo así logrará el éxito; desde hace mucho tiempo quiere aumentar las ventas,  sabe que así aumentaran sus ganancias, no posee de suficiente capital para invertir en insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar licuadoras, planchas, grabadoras etc. Elena Hermelinda es muy responsable y tiene excelentes referencias de pago, se siente muy contenta por el apoyo y asegura que podrá cancelar el financiamiento y a la vez ofrecerle mejor calidad de para su familia.
texts.en:
Elena Hermelinda, 49, lives with her husband and son in her own house.  She sells varied home appliances and has been in business several years; she has quite a bit of sales experience that makes it possible for her to earn the expected profits.  Her business is located in a spot that she deems is excellent for commercial activities because it has many customers because people know that what Elena sells is high quality at affordable prices and service is unequaled.  She’s a determined woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She likes to take advantage of opportunities that arise because she knows this is the only way to achieve success.  

She’s wanted to increase sales for some time now because she knows that profits will increase this way too but she does not have enough capital to invest in supplies which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy blenders, irons, tape recorders, etc.  Elena Hermelinda is very responsible and has excellent payment references.  She feels very happy with the support and is sure that she can repay the loan while offering her family improved quality of life.

loans.use: to buy blenders, irons and tape recorders.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge Luis, mayor de edad casado con dos hijos menores de edad, él es originario de Villanueva ubicado al norte del departamento de Chinandega, es propietario de una farmacia veterinaria, el realiza sus compras por pedidos a los proveedores que distribuyen en la zona y compra al contado, sus ventas las realiza al contado y al crédito, también el ofrece el servicio de veterinario especialidad que estudio en la universidad, el inicia su negocio cuando aún estudiaba medina veterinaria, lo hace con el apoyo de su mama  y con la intención de ayudar con los gastos de sus estudios debido a que su mama no podría costearle sus estudio por lo que su hermana entraría a estudiar también en la universidad, y no contaban con el apoyo de su papa, hoy en día tiene 5 años de tener el negocio. Jorge solicita financiamiento para invertir en el negocio en la compra de variedades productos de  medicina para la farmacia, para que genere más ganancias, uno de sus sueños es expandir más su negocio y brindarles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is a married adult with two minor-age children.  He is originally from Villanueva, which is located in the northern part of the Chinandega region.  He is the owner of a veterinary pharmacy.  He gets his products from suppliers that distribute in the zone and he purchases the items with cash.  He does his selling by cash and credit.  He also offers specialty veterinary services, which is what he studied at the university.  

He began his business when he was still studying veterinary medicine.  He was able to do this with the support of his mother and with the intention of helping with his school expenses; his mother could not fund his studies since his sister was also beginning to study at the university.  They did not count on the support of his father.

Today, he has been in this business for five years.  He is requesting funding in order to invest in his business, particularly in the purchase of various medicine products for his pharmacy.  In doing this, he will be able to generate higher profits.

One of his dreams is to expand his business more and to offer a better life to his children.

loans.use: to buy a variety of veterinary products and thereby offer a better product to the customers that visit his pharmacy.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.ru: Хакиму 45 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 несовершеннолетних детей. Хаким очень трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Он работает в строительной бригаде и определенная часть его работы это штукатурка. Он работает упорно каждый день в сезонный период. Сезонный период его работы начитается с марта и продолжается до ноября. Каждый день он зарабатывает от 100 сомони до 150 сомони и использует свой доход для нужды семьи. Его работа тяжелая и поэтому он потерял здоровье. Данное время у него мало работы и поэтому он хотел  бы лечиться. Однако у него нет денег для лечения, и его жена тоже не может помочь ему, так как  она является домохозяйкой. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки лекарства для своего лечения. Он серьезно болен и с не терпением ждет вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Hakim is 45 years old.  He is married and is raising 2 minors.  Hakim is a very hardworking and kind person.  He works as part of a construction crew, specifically as a plasterer.  He works hard every day during the season.  His work season starts in March and lasts until November.  Every day he earns from 100 somoni to 150 somoni and uses his earnings for the needs of the family.  His work is hard and this is why he lost his health.  Right now he does not have a lot of work so he would like to seek medical treatment.  Alas he does not have money for treatment and his wife cannot help him because she is a homemaker.  He is asking for a loan of 1000 somoni to purchase medicine for his treatment.  He is seriously ill and is anxiously waiting for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy medicine for his treatment

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 36 years old and a business lady, who runs a photography shop. She has been in business for the past ten years. She previously practiced freelance photography. She is very hard-working and, thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has expanded her business. 

Someday she hopes to open another photography shop. Now, she needs a loan of 105,300 KES to buy a camera, a video camera and a photography printing machine.

loans.use: to buy a camera, a video camera, and a photography printing machine

loans.name: Husein

texts.en: Hussein is a 33-year-old married man who has been working as a barber for fifteen years now. Due to his experience in the business and his passion for the profession, Hussein’s client base has expanded considerably over the years. For this reason, he is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua. He will invest the money from the loan to enlarge the capacity of his salon by buying more chairs. With the remaining amount, he will buy hair-care materials like gel and creams.

loans.use: to enlarge the capacity of his salon by buying more chairs.

loans.name: Cintia Gissella

texts.es: Cinthia  vive en el cantón playas. Ella tiene 25 años de edad y es soltera. Como no tiene hijos toma la decisión de buscar  un trabajo para poder estudiar y superarse. Con el pasar del tiempo y al no encontrar la oportunidad de salir a delante decide juntar un dinero para aperturar su propio negocio.  Tomo la inicia de la venta  de marisco, poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo y en la  actualidad a adquirió una buena clientela.  Todos los días  se levanta a las 6 am y se dirige a su puesto de trabajo ubicado por el  malecón. Aquí sus productos son muy reconocidos por ser frescos. Con el préstamo comprara vitrina, congelador, varios etc. Su meta es poder crecer en su propio negocio y contar con un capital necesario para abrir otro negocio de mariscos.
texts.en:
Cintia lives in the canton of Playas.  She is 25 years old and is single.  Since she does not have children, she decided to look for work in order to be able to study and better herself.  As time passed and she did not find an opportunity to get ahead, she decided to put together the money to start her own business.  She decided to sell seafood, and little by little her business has grown to the point where she now has a good customer base.

Everyday she gets up at 6 a.m. and goes to her stall which is located near the seafront boardwalk.  Here her products are well known for being fresh.

With this loan she will buy various showcases and freezers.  Her goal is to grow her business and to put together the capital necessary to open another seafood business.

loans.use: to buy various showcases and freezers.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 26 years old and married with one child. Moustafa is the only provider in the family.
He owns a small shop selling tools and supplies. He established his business in 2009. He gained good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a youth loan of $3,000 to renovate his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
DON ALEJANDRO
Es originario de la comunidad  las Mejoranas Chipata Santa Apolonia, Chimaltenango el se dedica a la compra y venta de granadias y aguacates, también a la compra y venta de leña y carbón, el se dedica a esta actividad desde hace algunos años ya que es el medio que el tiene para salir adelante.
El sale a comprar sus productos  en todas la comunidades cercanas de donde vive y después  sale a venderlos a la capital, el ya es bien conocido por todas las personas de las diferentes comunidades que recorre a diario.
Gracias al apoyo de su esposa y sus hijos el sigue adelante con su negocio ya que el empezó con un pequeño negocio y gracias a Dios ahora ya cuenta con un negocio un poco mas grande.
El sueño de el es ampliar mas su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y asi mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Esta solicitando este credito para la compra de granadias y compra de leña para la venta.
texts.en:
Alejandro is from the Mejoranas Chipata community in Santa Apolonia, Chimaltenango.  He buys and sells pomegranates and avocados.  He also buys and sells charcoal and firewood.  He has been doing this business activity for some years because it is his means to getting ahead.

He goes to buy his products in all of the communities that are close to where he lives.  He later goes to the capital to sell them.  He is well known by all of the people in the different communities he goes to daily.

Thanks to the help from his wife and children, he gets ahead with his business.  He started with a small business, and thanks to God, he now has a business that is a little bit bigger.

His dream is to expand his business in order to have better income.  This way he will improve his family’s quality of life.  He is requesting this loan to buy pomegranates and firewood to sell.

loans.use: to buy pomegranates and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua sells provisions in Kufur, near Elmina. Akosua has no formal education.  She is divorced and has two children. She is responsible for supporting her children.

Akosua has been selling provisions for two years. She will use her loan to buy more provisions for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to buy more provisions, for resale in her store.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is a 51-year-old, hard-working man with four children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He decided to set up a retail shop in order to provide basics to his growing family. Price fluctuation and high license fees affect his business growth, while his dreams are to trade in wholesale and to educate his children up to the University. 

Augustine intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise to sell, such as cooking oil and sugar.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise to sell, such as cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
Houssam is a 28-year-old single man who has owned an electronics repair shop for seven years now. Over the years, he has developed experience in this business, besides his passion for this industry.

Constantly seeking expansion and development in his business, Houssam is applying for his first youth loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua. He will invest the loan in buying spare parts for various electronics such as video players, remote controllers, televisions, etc.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for various electronics.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua extracts palm oil and palm kernel oil, for sale at Dabir, near Elmina. She has done this work for some years now. She is married and has four children.   Ekua uses her income to support her husband in feeding and clothing their children.

Ekua will use her loan to purchase palm fruit and palm kernels, from which to extract oils for sale. With the new profit, she will buy a machine for the more efficient production of her palm kernel oil.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruit and palm kernels, from which she will extract oils for sale.

loans.name: Naji

texts.en:
Naji is a 58-year-old married man, father of three children. He has been working selling artificial flowers for  ten years. Naji is well-known in his region for the good quality and for products provided upon customers' requests.

Today he is applying for his first loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his business merchandise with the latest artificial flowers. This loan will help him a lot in responding to his customers' needs easily.

He hopes to keep on expanding his business more and more and to keep on pleasing his customers and replying to his family's needs.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with the latest artificial flowers

loans.name: Najat

texts.en:
Najat is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. For three years now, she has been baking 'tannour' and 'manakeesh' (cheese-stuffed bread) and selling them in her village. 'Tannour' is a traditional type of Lebanese flatbread baked in a kiln-like oven. 

Najat is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, to buy the flour needed for her production. She will use the rest of the money to pay her children’s school installment fees. This is Najat’s first loan from Al Majmoua and she is optimistic about her experience which will allow her to ensure the stable income she needs to support her household.

loans.use: to buy the flour needed for her production

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married and has 6 children. Rebecca cooks the local Fante dish called kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in plantain or banana leaves) for sale. She has done this work for 2 years now. She uses her income to support her husband and to feed, clothe, and pay her children’s school fees. 

Rebecca will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and firewood to produce her kenkey. With the new profits, she plans to expand her kenkey business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and firewood to produce kenkey.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba operates a chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold) and also produces charcoal for sale. Araba works in Waakrom, near Cape Coast, and has done so for 2 years now. Araba is a single parent and has 4 children. She uses her income to feed her family and pay her children's school fees.

Araba will use her loan to purchase supplies and the necessary food ingredients to prepare and operate her chop bar, and also to purchase fire wood necessary for the production of charcoal. With the new profits, Araba plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and the necessary food ingredients to prepare and operate her chop bar, and also to purchase fire wood necessary for the production of charcoal.

loans.name: Donya Al-Hodeida Group

texts.en:
Donya Al-Hodeida Group is a group of 4 ladies who live in Hodeida, Yemen. They have requested a loan worth 80,000 YER.

Aisha is a mother of 3 children. She has been selling perfumes and incense in order to help her husband with their family's basic requirements. The loan she has applied for will be used to invest in purchasing perfumes, incense, clothes, and an ice-cream maker.

Aisha hopes to earn a good income, which will allow her to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing perfumes, incense, clothes, and an ice cream maker.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en: Claire is a 28-year-old, hard-working woman, living in Kyenjojo,Uganda. She has been operating a bar, and with profits from that business she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Price fluctuations, and inadequate capital to meet the high demand, are challenges that affect the growth of her business. Her business plan is to own a five star hotel, one day. Claire intends to use the loan to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda to sell in her pub.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a 26-year-old married woman and mother of one child. Two years ago, she started operating a cellular phone store and has gradually developed her client base in the region. Hiba sells mobile phones, prepaid recharge cards and phone accessories.

Seeking diversification and expansion in her business, Hiba is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua. She will use the money to buy women's accessories and make-up. With this supplement, Hiba will be able to further satisfy the needs of her female clients.

loans.use: to buy women's accessories and make-up

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is a fish monger, who sells smoked and fried fish in Kufur, near Elmina. Ekua has no formal education. She is single and has one child. She is responsible for supporting herself and her child. 

Ekua has been selling prepared fish for the past 10 years. Her loan will be used to buy more fish from local fishermen. She hopes to use the new profits from her business, to further expand her fish preparation business.

loans.use: to buy more fish from local fishermen, which she will smoke or fry, and then sell.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of two school-going children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for three years. She was initially carrying out farming full-time, but after a certain sale, she used the proceeds as capital for a retail shop. The shop mainly deals in assorted plastic and household items.

Zipporah was introduced to Milango by her friends. She is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of retail items like shoes, plates, cups, basins, combs, etc. 

She intends to save the additional income for future projects. Her main ambition is to open a wholesale shop.

Zipporah believes this will help improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to add stock of retail items like shoes, plates, cups, basins, combs, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a resident of Kongowea of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has one child, who is in school. Esther owns a tailoring shop, a business that she has been running for four years. She also owns a retail shop and carries out farming.

She learned about Milango from an employee, and joined the institution with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is high commodity prices.

Esther is applying for a loan of 43,200 Kenyan shillings to purchase clothes, sewing machines, handbags, etc. for sale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standards of her family, especially her child’s education.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, sewing machines, handbags, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes for his business to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Santisima Trinidad Group

texts.es: Dúo Santisima Trinidad. este grupo esta conformado por la señora francisca Catalina, ella tiene 60 años de edad, ella se dedica a vender productos de cosmeticos se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 14 años ya que gracias a Dios, Él le a dado las fuerzas y le a dado la oportunidad de tener su negocito, es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de cosmeticos para la venta.
texts.en:
Francisca Catalina is part of the Dúo Santisima Trinidad (Holy Trinity Duo). She is 60 years old and makes a living selling cosmetics. She has been working in this business for 14 years, since God gave her the strength and opportunity to own her own small business. 

She is applying for this loan to buy cosmetics, which she will then sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Dúo San Marcos Group

texts.es: Dúo San Marcso. Este grupo esta conformado por la señora Maria Elena, ella tiene 45 años de edad es casada y tiene tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de refacciones desde hace 15 años, le ha gustado mucho su venta ya que se relaciona con muchas persona que la visitan a diario, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la elaboracion de refacciones y asi continuar con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is part of the Dúo San Marco (Saint Mark Duo). She is 45 years old and married with three children. She has made a living selling snacks for 15 years. She has enjoyed her sales because she is able to interact with many people who visit her on a daily basis. 

She is applying for a loan to buy ingredients to make snacks, so that she can continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make snacks.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda, de 40 años es madre de 02 hijos, Yemilet de 13 años y Frank de 07 años, quienes son su motivación para trabajar duro y  brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.  Está casada con Edson de 47 años, quien es electricista. Todos juntos habitan en su casa propia, inmueble que sus padres le regalaron. El trabajo de Nilda consiste en la realizar piñatas que son muñecos rellenos con juguetes infantiles, articulo muy utilizados para celbrar cumpleaños u otros eventos, para ella este trabajo es muy divertido. Para ello cuenta con una  tienda, ubicada en un lugar cómodo y amplio en el interior de su casa, ahí espera a sus clientes con quienes conversa y brinda algunas alternativas para las creacion y forma de piñatas, asimismo confecciona gorros, tarjetas y demás accesorios que se usan, más en los cumpleaños para niños. Al mismo tiempo, ofrece a sus clientes la preparación y venta de tortas decoradas, al gusto del cliente. 
Lleva realizando este trabajo por más de 03 años, tiempo que le sirvió para hacerse conocida por la calidad del servicio que brinda. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la creación de piñatas pero para otras personas, hoy lo hace de manera independiente, permitiendole tener buenos ingresos economicos.  Le esta yendo muy bien con su negocio y como toda mujer emprendedora tiene metas y sueños que en algún momento le gustaría realizar.  Pero por ahora solo desea mantener su negocio para seguir juntando el capital suficiente para ampliar y crecer comercialmente. Por ello solicita de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Asimismlo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de 2,000 soles, comprará mercadería y materiales necesarios para la confección de piñatas y decoración de fiestas infantiles como peluches, carteles, globos, juguetes infantiles, serpentinas y otros, así podrá continuar con su negocio ya que desea aumentar su producción para así tener listo ante la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nilda is 40 years old and has two children: Yemilet, 13 years old, and Frank, 7 years old. They motivate her to work hard and offer them a better quality of life. She is married to Edson, who is 47 and works as an electrician. They all live in their own house, which her parents gave to them.

Nilda's work consists of making piñatas, which are dolls filled with children's toys. They are very commonly used to celebrate birthdays or other events. This work is very enjoyable for her. She has a store, which is located in a comfortable and spacious part of her house. She receives her clients there. She speaks with them and offers them options for the creation and form of the piñatas. She also makes hats, cards, and other accessories which are used for children's parties. At the same time, she offers her clients the service of preparing and selling decorated cakes to their liking.

She has been working in this business for more than 3 years, in which she has made herself known for the quality of the service which she offers. Before this business, she also worked in piñata making, but for other people. Now she works independently, which allows her to have a good income. 

Her business is going very well, and as an enterprising woman, she has goals and dreams that she would like to accomplish at some point. For now, however, she only wishes to maintain her business so that she can continue saving money to expand and grow as a businesswoman. Therefore, she is asking for contributions so that she can make her plan a reality. She is committed to paying her quotas on time. 

With the requested amount of 2,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy merchandise and necessary materials for the creation of piñatas and the decoration of children's parties, such as stuffed animals, posters, balloons, toys, and streamers, among others. She will then be able to continue with her business, because she wants to increase her production so that she is ready for her clients' demands.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and the necessary materials to make piñatas and children's party decorations, such as stuffed animals, posters, balloons, toys, and streamers, among others.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She has owned a convenience store for three years now. She likes her work and puts much effort into improving it and expanding it. Maryam is well known in the region for her good reputation and special customer service. 

Maryam is applying for her first loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, in order to increase her merchandise with new released goods and special offer products that will enhance her income and consequently improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new released goods and special offer products

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a single parent and has five children. She sells vegetables, such as tomatoes, garden eggs (a type of fruit), onions, and other food items in Wakrom, near Cape Coast. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees. 

Comfort will use her loan to purchase a variety of vegetables to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Comfort plans to improve and grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa María de 47 años de edad, soltera, con tres hijos bajo su cargo 17,22 y 25 años de edad, ella es propietaria de un salón de belleza  anteriormente estaba ubicado en su casa de habitación, ahora lo traslado al mercado central  local que alquila aun precio cómodo,  en la actualidad ha logrado mantener el negocio gracia al buen servicio que le brinda a sus cliente, con la experiencia que  ha  adquirido durante todo estos años le ha ayudado a captar más clientes, Rosa se entrega al trabajo ya que ella ama su profesión en lo que le ha permitido irse superándose poco a poco  ella está solicitando el financiamiento para invertir en productos de belleza como: tintes, brochas, alisadores, planchas, maquillajes, crema para pediquiur, tratamiento para el cabello entre otros.  Ya que en este negocio tiene que tener bien surtido para así ofrecerles servicios de calidad a sus clientes.-
texts.en:
Rosa María is 47 years old and single with three children under her care, ages 17, 22, and 25. She owns a beauty salon. The salon was formerly located in her home, but she relocated to the central marketplace, where she rents a space for a good price. 

She has managed to maintain her business thanks to the good service which she offers to her clients. The experience she has acquired in the past years has helped her to attract more clients. Rosa devotes herself to her work because she loves her profession, which has allowed her to improve herself little by little.

She is applying for a loan to invest in beauty products, such as dye, brushes, hair smoothers, straighteners, makeup, pedicure creams, and hair treatments, among others. One must be well-stocked in this business to offer quality services to clients.

loans.use: to invest in beauty products such as hair smoothers, makeup, creams, dye, and brushes, among others.

loans.name: Katherine Lisbeth

texts.es: Katherine vive en el cantón playas .Ella tiene 31 años. Ella es casada y tiene tres hijos  menores de edad.  Tomo la decisión de buscar trabajo  para que puedan sus hijos estudiar. Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar .Ella decide  juntar dinero que tenia  y dar apertura  a su negocio propio. En la actualidad su negocio  es bazar y novedades, poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  una excelente  clientela. Katherine se levanta 6:30 de la mañana , va a dejar  a sus hijos a la escuela, luego abre  su negocio a las 8 a m .Con el préstamo comprara  perfume , bisutería , varios . Su meta poder comprar un vehículo  para poder  realizar las entrega de su mercadería  a otros lugares más  distantes.
texts.en:
Katherine lives in the Playas canton. She is 31 years old. She is married and has three minor children. She decided to look for work so that her children could study. Since no one gave her the opportunity to work, she decided to collect the money that she had and open her own business. Now, her business is a stationery and novelties shop. Little by little, she grew to have an excellent clientele.

Katherine gets up at 6:30 in the morning. She leaves to take her children to school, and then opens her business at 8:00 am. With the loan, she will buy perfume, jewelry, and various other items. Her goal is to be able to buy a vehicle to be able to carry out her deliveries to more distant places.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, jewelry, and various other items.

loans.name: Faleh

texts.en:
Faleh is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and has two children. Faleh is the only provider of the family.

Faleh is a carpenter, who makes furniture. He established his business in 2000, and now he has two employees. He built a good experience in this field, and he is well-known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting the sum of $3,000 to pay the year's rent for his workshop, and to increases his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the year's rent for his furniture workshop, and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a resident of Kongowea of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has two children who are in school.  Janet owns a tailoring shop, a business that she has been running for eight years. She has also owns a retail shop and carries out farming. 

She learnt about Milango from an employee and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is high prices for goods.  

Janet is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase cloth, a sewing machine, and handbags, etc. for sale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of the family, and especially for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase cloth, a sewing machine, and handbags, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Jihad Group

texts.en: Jihad group is made up of five ladies who applied for a loan of 95,000 YER. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. Three years ago, the 22-year-old Sabah began her business by selling perfumes, incense and clothes door-to-door, after a period of time saving some of her daily package money. She has applied for a youth loan to buy perfumes, incense and clothes to expand her business where she hopes to earn a good income, which will allow her to improve her own and her family's quality of life. She is hoping with this extra profit she will be able to renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, incense and clothes for resale

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is a hardworking man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. For two years now, he has been operating a retail shop and it is located on a busy street hence attracting many customers. Price fluctuation and inadequate capital affects the business while his dream is to own a wholesale shop. Good father that he is, he dreams of educating his children up to the university.

Sam intends to use the loan to purchase general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to purchase general merchadise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a resident of the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has five children. He operates a clothes business that has been in operation for two years. He learned about Milango Financial Services through a friend, with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of his business. His main challenge is a seasonal business climate.

Hamisi is applying for a loan of KES 21,050 (Kenya shillings) to buy clothes for his business, e.g., blouses, trousers, skirts, and towels. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to increase his income and improve the living standard of his life, especially his children’s education. Hamisi aspires to open a boutique and a cosmetic business.

loans.use: to buy clothes for his business, e.g., blouses, trousers, skirts, and towels.

loans.name: Sulejka

texts.es:
Sulejka, de 42 años, es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y muy dinámica. Es conviviente con Justo de 48 años quien es empleado y  tienen 3 hijos: Iván de 15 años, Ximena de 11 años  y la menor Saori de 1 año de edad.
