Vive en compañía de su pareja y sus hijos  en la casa de sus suegros. La actividad que realiza Sulejka  es la venta de comidas rápidas como salchipapas, pollos broasther, arroz chaufa y otros. La venta la realiza en el frontis de su vivienda, desde muy temprano inicia su labor cuando va al mercado en busca de los mejores ingredientes, ahí  aprovecha para  hacer el mercado de la comida diaria, una vez en su casa comienza a preparar sus deliciosos platos que le han hecho muy conocida en su barrio. Lleva realizando éste trabajo por más de 2 años y lo hace con la ayuda de su hermana. 
Lo considera rentable porque le genera buenos ingresos económicos, antes de empezar con éste negocio trabajaba para otras personas y tenía muchas dificultades ya que no tenía buenos ingresos económicos y siempre sufría para pagar algunos gastos del hogar, pero con el tiempo decidió que era momento de empezar su negocio propio y ser independiente. Ahora le está yendo mucho mejor ya que tiene sus propio negocio y desea seguir creciendo y convertirse en una prospera empresaria. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará ingredientes para la preparación de comidas rápidas como patatas, aceite en cajas y otros en mayor volumen,  para seguir realizando su trabajo.  Además necesita refaccionar algunas sillas y mesas para atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sulejka is 42 years old. She is a hardworking, enterprising, and dynamic woman. Her partner, Justo, is 48 years old and works as an employee. They have three children: Ivan, 15 years old, Ximena, 11 years old, and the youngest, Saori, who is one year old. She lives with her partner and children in her in-laws' house.

Sulejka makes a living selling fast food such as salchipapas (fried potatoes with hot dogs), broasted chicken, fried rice, and other foods. She sells these dishes in front of her house. She starts work in the early morning, when she goes to the market in search of the best ingredients. There, she takes advantage of the opportunity to do her daily shopping. Once she gets home, she starts to prepare her delicious dishes, which have made her very well-known in her neighborhood. She has been working in this business for more than two years, with the help of her sister.

She believes that her work is profitable because it generates a good income. Before starting this business, she worked for other people and had a difficult time because she did not earn a good income. She always suffered in order to pay her home expenses. Eventually, she decided that it was time to start her own business and become independent. Now that she has her own business, everything is going much better. She wishes to continue growing and become a prosperous entrepreneur.

With the requested loan amount of 1000 Peruvian soles, she will buy ingredients to make fast food, such as potatoes, boxes of oil, and others, in large quantities. She will then be able to continue with her business. She also needs to refurbish some chairs and tables in order to better serve her clients.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make fast food such as potatoes and boxes of oil, among others.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a resident of the Kilifi area of Coast province, Kenya. She is the mother of one child. Millicent owns a food cafe, a business that she has been running for seven years. In this stall, she sells cooked potatoes, beverages, and buns.

She learned about Milango Financial Services from an employee and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge has been bad debts and inflation.

Millicent is applying for a loan of KES 21,100 (Kenya shillings) to purchase wheat flour, cooking fat, sugar, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standard of the family, especially the education of her children. She aspires to own a hotel in the future.

loans.use: to purchase for her cafe, wheat flour, cooking fat, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is 33 years old, married, and has been blessed with two children.  She is very hard-working and also relies on her husband's salary.

She used her previous loan to renovate her business premises, where she carries on business selling groundnuts. She has been in business for the past 16 years. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has provided a better lifestyle for her family. 

Now, Carolyne requires a loan of 84,442 KES to pay school fees. She hopes to open a wholesale shop, someday.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a resident of the Mariakani area of Coast province in Kenya. She is a married business lady.  Margaret owns a retail shop, a business that she has been running for three years. In this shop, she sells paraffin, sugar, flour, etc. Margaret has two children. 

She learned about Milango from other clients and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. The main challenge is high competition from other retail and wholesale shops, but, she believes she can make more sales from increased levels of stock.  She aspires to own a wholesale shop in future.

Margaret is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to build a business premises. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her family's living standard. She aspires to own other centers and plan for her children’s education with much security.

loans.use: to build a business premises.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase retail stock like flour, sugar, cereals, soap, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a business lady and runs a clothes business which she has been operating for ten years. In this business she sells shawls, handbags, pants, shoes, etc. She also sells charcoal and is formally employed.

She learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are bad debts and competition. 

Josephine is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of secondhand items like bedsheets, shoes and clothing. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help open a stall in the town. Her dream is to open a larger boutique which can provide more income to educate her child.

loans.use: To purchase secondhand items like bedsheets, shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine lives in the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has five children. 

She owns a green grocery, which she has been operating for four years. In this business, Mary sells vegetables like tomatoes and kale. She began the business from the income from a farming business; she sold one cow to obtain a startup capital.

Mary learned about Milango through a friend. Her aim is to access credit to improve the business operations. The challenges she faces are price fluctuation and inflation, stock purchasing, and the seasonal business climate.

Mary is applying for a loan of 21,450 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables wholesale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to purchase clothes and set up a boutique, in addition to helping educate her children.

loans.use: To buy vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more coconut leaves and threads to sell as roofing materials.

loans.name: Jenny Patricia

texts.es:
Jenny Patricia tiene 37 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene cinco hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.
LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Jenny Patricia  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza en el cantón Ventanas. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas e insumos, urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque se podrá comprar lo necesario para las plnataciones.

Con el dinero  del prestamo anterior pudo comprar semillas y los fertilizantes. En la familia la relación ha mejorado porque ahora puede aportar un poco más para el bienestar de la familia, en el trabajo le va mucho mejor porque a aumentado la producción en los ingresos a mejorado mucho porque ahora con la venta de los productos obtiene más ingresos. 
El sueño comprar una maquinaria agrícola. En el timepo libre le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Jenny Patricia is 37 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has five children. She lives with her husband and children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank “Dulce Sentimiento” (Sweet Sentiment) is located in the neighborhood of Caimito II in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, canton of Pueblo Viejo. The members of the Communal Bank are short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Jenny Patricia is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and pigeon peas. Her purchases and sales are conducted in the canton of Ventanas. Jenny is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, farming supplies, urea, herbicide, fertilizers, and weed killers so that she can keep her crops in good condition.

This loan will be a great help because she will be able to buy what she needs for planting. The money from her previous loan was used to buy seeds and fertilizers. Her family’s situation has improved because she now earns a little bit more to provide for their well-being. She is doing better in her work since she has been able to increase production. Her income has improved now that she generates more revenue from the sale of her products.

Her dream is to buy a piece of farming equipment. In her free time, Jenny Patricia enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: to buy seeds, farming supplies, urea, herbicide, fertilizers, and weed killers.

loans.name: Ivonne Del Socorro

texts.es: Ivonne, 38 años de edad, de oficio comerciante, madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos. Es dueña de una pequeña pulpería en la ciudad de León. Tiene 7 años con este negocio en el cual vende desde una aguja hasta una chiltoma, todo lo vende por unidad. 	Poco a poco fue agregando la venta de jugos, gaseosas, agua embotellada. Actualmente vende juguetes durante la temporada, aceite, productos enlatados. Uno de sus propósitos es vender ropa adicionalmente. Por eso está solicitando el crédito para comprar ropa y  zapatos  para niños. Uno de sus planes es poner un negocio de Cyber Café de esta manera conseguir nueva forma de ingreso para pagar la universidad a su hija menor.
texts.en:
Ivonne is a 38 year old working mother of three.  She is the owner of a small grocery store in the city of Leon.  She has been running this business for seven years where she sells anything from a sewing needle to hot peppers in single units.

Little by little she has been accumulating the sale of juices, sodas, and bottled water.  During the appropriate seasons, she sells toys, oils, and canned goods.  One of her ideas is to also sell clothes.  This is why she is seeking a loan to purchase children's clothes and shoes.  She also plans on opening an internet cafe so that she can have new ways to generate revenue and thus being able to pay her youngest daughter's tuition.

loans.use: to purchase children's cltothes and shoes.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has five school-going children. He owns a tailoring shop and a clothes shop, businesses that he has been operating for six years. He started the business through his personal savings. He is also a plumber.

He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are purchasing stock, price fluctuations and inflation.

Augustine is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy clothes and materials for tailoring. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to buy another modern sewing machine. His future plan is to become a leading tailor, getting tenders from customers in the area, and to become a leading supplier of school uniforms.

loans.use: To buy clothes and material for tailoring.

loans.name: Marixsa Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Marixsa habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe en el barrio llamado Las Conchitas junto a su esposo quien labara por cuenta propia para poder llevar el sustento diario al hogar, ella labora para una empresa privada desde hace mas de 20 años, su prioridad en la actualidad es  mejorar su casa para eso requiere de capital para comprar los materiales necesarios, gracias al apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva atravez de un nuevo financiamiento comprara lo siguiente: Cemento, Hierro y Arena, muy contenta se encuentra doña Marixsa por la confianza brindada.
texts.en:
Marixsa lives with her husband, who is self-employed, in the city of Ticuantepe, in the neighborhood called Las Conchitas. To provide for the daily needs of the household, she has worked for a private company for more than 20 years. 

Marixsa's current priority is to improve her house. For that, she needs capital to buy the necessary materials. Thanks to the support of Afodenic and Kiva, she will buy the following with a new loan: cement, rebar, and sand. Marixsa is very happy that they have confidence in her.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. She is the mother of two children. She owns a retail shop, which has been in operation for seven years and has been a source of constant income to her family. In this shop, she sells cereals (grains).

Regina learned of Milango from a company employee. She joined in order to access credit for her business. Regina is asking for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to purchase retail stock, like cereals and cooking fat.

Regina believes that the loan will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs more easily. Regina’s desire is to grow her business into a wholesale one. She is full of praise for Milango, for all its assistance. The challenges that Regina faces are inflation and high related fees.

loans.use: To purchase retail stock, like cereals (grains) and cooking fat.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es: Isabel, de 25 años de edad, casada, madre de 2 hijos, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de un pequeño restaurante turístico en las afueras de León, donde la especialidad son los sabrosos y frescos pescados fritos, recién salidos del mar imponente de León. Ella inicio sus actividades a los 18 años de edad cuando adquirió un pequeño terreno con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio fue invirtiendo en  la construcción de un Bar y  restaurante campestre. Actualmente es muy visitado por los turistas, sus labores las comparte con su esposo quien le ayuda atender el negocio, pues es su única fuente de ingresos. Ella está requiriendo el crédito para comprar pescados, langostas, lentejas, conchas, camarón, jugos, gaseosas, cervezas. Su idea es ampliar más su restaurante tener una mejor infraestructura y ofrecer un mejor servicio con calidad a su clientela y contratar mano de obra
texts.en: Isabel is 25 years old. She is married with two children and works in retail. She is the owner of a small restaurant that caters to tourists, located outside of León. Her restaurant specializes in delicious and freshly caught fried fish, from the magnificent ocean of León. She started her business when she was 18 years old when she purchased a small plot of land, and with much effort and sacrifice she invested in the construction of a rustic bar and restaurant. Her restaurant gets high volume of tourist customers. She shares the work of the restaurant with her husband, as it is the only source of income their family has. She has requested a loan to buy fish, lobsters, shellfish, shrimp, lentils, juices, soft drinks and beer. Her idea is to expand her restaurant, improve the infrastructure, offer better customer service and hire additional staff.

loans.use: to buy fish, lobsters, shellfish, shrimp, lentils, juices, soft drinks and beer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing like bed sheets, shoes, and clothes.

loans.name: Dúo Libano Group

texts.es: Dúo Libano, este dúo esta integrado por la señora Thelma quen tiene 33 años de edad ella es casada y tiene dos hijos, ella desde hace tiempo se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, le da gracias a Dios ya que su negocio poco a poco ba creciendo es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la venta ya que su clientela siempre le piden productos que ella no tiene por la demanda que presentan su clientes, espera que por medio de ustedes ella pueda seguir luchando para salir adelante.
texts.en: Thelma is one part of the two-person group called "Dúo Libano." She is 33 years old, married, and has two children. For a while, she has worked selling daily food staples. She thanks God that her business has been growing little by little. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of groceries to sell because her customers always ask her for products that she doesn't have. She hopes that through Kiva, she will be able to keep striving to get ahead by meeting this customer demand.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Viki

texts.es:
Viki es una mujer de 22 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar Viki no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar y en algunas ocasiones prepara un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Viki trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de bebidas y golosinas, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la  mañana y puede hacerlo por una aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Viki se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como golosinas, panetones, bebidas, chocolates y otros; de esta manera Viki tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de tener su casas propia.
texts.en:
Viki is a 22-year-old woman who is single and lives in the city of Ica with her parents and siblings. She is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has the drive to succeed. Unfortunately, due to the lack of financial resources and the need to work, Viki was not able to study for a professional degree as she would have liked. She enjoys cooking in her free time. On a few occasions, she will prepare a delicious dish of chicken and rice to share with her family.

Through her own initiative and with great effort and dedication, Viki manages a small business in which she sells beverages and snack foods. She begins every day during the early morning hours and is able to work approximately eight hours. Viki enjoys her work and believes she is doing well because of the friendly service she provides to her customers.

Viki is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, she will be able to buy merchandise for her business such as snack foods, panettones, beverages, chocolates, and other products. As a result, Viki will have a business that is well-stocked so that she can serve more customers. She will continue working and striving to move forward so that she can achieve her greatest dream of having a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Audri Del Rocío

texts.es:
Audri Del Roció tiene 37 años de edad es casada tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Audri del Rocio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza en el cantón Ventanas. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

Con el dinero  del prestamo anterior pudo comprar semillas y fertilizantes para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

Las compras y las ventas de los productos lo hace en la ciudad de Ventanas. El sueño es que los hijos sean profesionales. En el tiempo libre le gusta leer y ver televisión.

"Está muy agradecido por la ayuda brindada".
texts.en:
Audri Del Roció is 37 years old, married, and has three children. She lives with her husband and children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank “Dulce Sentimiento” (Sweet Sentiment) is located in the neighborhood of Caimito II in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, canton of Pueblo Viejo. The members of the Communal Bank are short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Audri Del Roció is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and pigeon peas. Her purchases and sales are conducted in the canton of Ventanas. Audri is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, farming supplies, urea, herbicide, fertilizers, and weed killers so that she can keep her crops in good condition.

With the money from her previous loan, she was able to buy seeds and fertilizers so that she could maintain the excellent condition of her crops. Those purchases were made in the city of Ventanas.

Her dream is to see her children become professionals. In her free time, Audri Del Roció enjoys reading and watching television. She says, “I am very grateful for the assistance that has been offered.”

loans.use: to buy seeds, farming supplies, urea, herbicide, fertilizers, and weed killers.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 36-year-old ambitious man with five children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. After realizing that farming alone could not help him meet the day-to-day expenses of his family due to its seasonal nature, he decided to set up a retail shop. Price fluctuation and bad weather affect the business.

John's dream is to own a wholesale shop. He intends to use this loan to buy general merchandise, such as salt and rice, to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as salt and rice, to sell.

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simion lives in the Malindi area of Coast province, Kenya. He is a married father of two school-going children. Simon has owned and operated a green grocery stall for close to three years, selling greens, fruits, vegetables, cereals, etc. He is also employed.

Simion learned about Milango through a friend and joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His major challenges are bad debts and the high cost of transport. Simion is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables wholesale. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to expand the business. Simion's plans for the future are to start other businesses and to open stalls in different areas.

loans.use: To buy vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is a petty trader; she sells yams, maize, and groundnuts in Waakrom, near Cape Coast. Ama is married and has eight children. Her husband is a driver. 

Aba uses her income to assist her husband with the general upkeep of their family. She will use her loan to purchase tubs of yams, bags of maize, and sacks of groundnuts to sell. With the new profit from the loan, Aba will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase tubs of yams, bags of maize, and sacks of groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Renzo Javier

texts.es:
Renzo es un joven de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Imperial con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Renzo se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Renzo trabaja como Serenazgo, brindando servicios de seguridad en diversas calles de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Renzo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá comprar materiales de construcción, ya que desea realizar refacciones en el techo de su vivienda, ya que al acercarse las épocas de lluvia,  espera poder brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Renzo is a young man who is 20 years of age. He is single and lives in the city of Imperial with his parents and siblings. Renzo is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has the drive to succeed. Thanks to his efforts and the support of his parents, Renzo is studying for a professional degree in Business Administration. He enjoys playing soccer in his free time. On a few occasions, he will prepare a delicious dish of “carapulcra con sopa seca” (a spicy Peruvian stew served with dried potatoes) to share with his family.

Through his own initiative and with great effort and dedication, Renzo works as a patrol guard. He provides security services by driving along different streets of the city. He begins every day in the early morning hours and is able to work approximately 10 hours. Renzo enjoys his work and believes he is doing well because he is well-adjusted in his job and treats others in a friendly manner.

Renzo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, he will be able to buy construction materials. He wants to make repairs to the roof of his house since the rainy season is approaching. Renzo hopes to provide more security and greater well-being for his family. He will continue working and striving toward accomplishing his greatest dream of becoming a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for repairing the roof of his house.

loans.name: Camilo Lorenzo

texts.es:
Camilo Lorenzo tiene 42 años de edad es casado tiene tres hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Camilo Lorenzo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza en el cantón Ventanas. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza, ranger.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque se podrá adquirir los insumos. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes, la competencia, las plagas y el mal tiempo. El sueño es sembrar más maíz y ayudar a los hijos con los estudios. En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Camilo Lorenzo is 42 years old, married, and has three children. He lives with his wife and children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank “Dulce Sentimiento” (Sweet Sentiment) is located in the neighborhood of Caimito II in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, canton of Pueblo Viejo. The members of the Communal Bank are short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Camilo Lorenzo is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and pigeon peas. His purchases and sales are conducted in the canton of Ventanas. He is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, urea, herbicide, fertilizers, weed killers, and Ranger (a specific brand of herbicide). This loan will be a great help because he will be able to acquire supplies. The challenges he faces on a frequent basis include dealing with the competition, pests, and bad weather.

His dreams include planting more corn and helping his children with their studies. In his free time, Camilo Lorenzo enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, herbicide, fertilizers, and weed killers.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a married businessman living within Malindi, Kenya. He owns a medical clinic and a pharmacy which have been in operation for three years. Geoffrey was previously employed in a clinic before he moved on to open his own center.

The challenge of obtaining additional funds for credit led Geoffrey to join Milango, He is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenya shillings to purchase more drugs and to renovate the clinic. Geoffrey also looks forward to opening a laboratory and a pharmacy in the area. He will use the additional income from this loan to build a residential house and hopes to save on the house rent he currently pays.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs and to renovate the clinic.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a resident of Malindi, Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has six children, four of whom are in school. Eunice owns a tailoring shop, a business that she has been running for twenty years. She also owns a grocery stall.

Eunice learned about Milango from an employee and joined the institution with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are high commodity prices and the seasonal business climate.

Eunice is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to purchase clothes and materials to make school uniforms in anticipation of school opening. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her family's living standard, especially their education.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and materials to make school uniforms.

loans.name: Tapaau

texts.en:
Tapaau is 42 years old and married, with two children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, and yams, so that she can sell them in her community, or at the market, with her children's help. She has been doing this for two years. 

Tapaau needs a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, some bush-knives, weedkiller spray, and more tiapula (an underground plant stem that serves as a storage organ by some plants). She is a new member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2012. Tapaau will use the profits from her sales to improve her family assets.

loans.use: to buy garden tools and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy brushes and a variety of paints for his business.

loans.name: Kolini

texts.en:
Kolini is 38 years old and married with six children. She hopes to start a small vegetable garden where she can grow fruits and vegetables to sell in her community or at the market. 

For this, Kolini needs a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, a shovel, fertilizer, weed killer spray, seedlings, and gardening gloves. She is a new member of SPBD in 2012 and joined to gain access to financial stability. Kolini hopes to use her earnings to improve her family assets, such as building her children a fixed house.

loans.use: to buy a fertilizer sack, gardening gloves, shovel, pick and other items.

loans.name: Fasitupe

texts.en: Fasitupe is 38 years old and married with 5 children. She has a small stall at the market where she sells in pounds such as carrots, potatoes, and tomatoes as well as sugar, laundry utensils, home-ware equipment and more, to earn a living. Fasitupe needs a loan to buy a sugar sack, farming stocks and home-ware equipment to help her with the business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011 to gain access to financial services. Fasitupe hopes to use her earnings to improve her family assets.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, plastic bags, dripping oil, gas oven, etc.

loans.name: Tapu

texts.en:
Tapu is a 28-year-old woman who is married, with three children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu, yams, and bananas that she can sell in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Tapu has requested a loan to buy more tiapula (an underground plant stem serving as a storage organ by some plants), a shovel, some bush knives, a rake, an axle and filing, and some fertilizer for her garden. She plans to use her profits to improve her family's assets. Tapu is a new member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBDA) in 2012.

loans.use: to buy gardening tools and supplies.

loans.name: Haydee Del Socorro

texts.es: Haydee  44 años, casada con un  dos  hijo ambos estudiantes uno de secundaria y otro de universidad, ella tiene varios tipos de negocio en su hogar buscando como ganarse la vida,  tiene un puesto de ventas de granos básicos llamado Enabas que les abastece el gobierno para vender más barato los granos básicos al pueblo, también en su casa hay un taller de repuestos y reparación de bicicletas donde trabaja su hijo y esposo y ella elabora fritanga por las tardes ubicados en su casa de habitación, Haydee diario se levanta muy temprano y cierra tarde para atender a sus clientes ofreciéndoles una excelente atención  ella inicia este negocio debido a las necesidades que ella tenía en su hogar y era una manera de poder apoyar en su hogar, negocio el cual tiene ya 20 años de surtir de buenos productos al pueblo. En este momento noes está solicitando financiamiento  para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, fósforos, sal arroz, azúcar, café, frijoles, jabón, detergentes, entre otros productos. Haydee está muy contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad que se le está brindando para invertir en su negocio sus clientes ha incrementado ella espera poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Haydee is 44 years old, married and has two children.  Both of her children go to school, one to secondary school and the other attends the university.  She has a few types of businesses run out of her home, as she is looking for a way to make a living.  She has a dry goods store called "Enabas" which is stocked by the government for low-cost re-sale to the people.  She also has a bicycle repair shop in her home, where her son and her husband work.  In addition, Haydee makes fried foods in her home in the afternoons.  Haydee gets up very early every day and closes up late, so she can tend to her customers and offer them excellent customer service.  She started her business because of her family's needs and as a way to help out in her home.  Haydee has been supplying the people with quality products for twenty years.  At this time, she is requesting a loan to purchase dry goods: sweets, matches, salt, rice, sugar, coffee, beans, soap, detergents and other products.  Haydee is very happy about and grateful for the opportunity she is being offered to invest in her business.  The number of customers she has, has increased, and she hopes to meet her customers demands.

loans.use: to invest in working capital, for instance purchasing dry goods like rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, soap and other items.

loans.name: Edwin Javier

texts.es:
Edwin es un hombre de 28 años, creció en una familia de escasos recursos en la cual consiguió el apoyo para terminar la escuela primaria, trabajó ayudando a sus padres desde muy joven y ahora está casado con Shirley de 33 años quien trabaja como secretaria en una oficina de impresión de fotos y con quien tiene 1 hijo aún pequeño a quien espera poder apoyarles en su educación hasta que se convierta en profesional. Edwin y su familia viven en la Parroquia de Bomobolí de Santo Domingo, la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una provincia de Ecuador que en los últimos años ha tenido un alto crecimiento sostenido. Su capital  es una ciudad en donde lo más atractivo y llamativo son sus deliciosas frutas, y la gastronomía que ofrecen en el lugar. También cuenta con un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Además cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos que acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Es por esto que la mayoría de sus habitantes han emprendido con alguna actividad comercial o de servicios para habitantes y turistas.
Edwin recorre por toda la ciudad y a veces por las afueras de la misma en su taxi que con mucho esfuerzo adquirió desde hace dos años. Con el apoyo de sus padres quienes también formaron parte de una compañía de taxis, Edwin emprendió en este duro y cansado trabajo al cual le dedica hasta 14 horas diarias sin un horario fijo y expuesto a los peligros de la delincuencia que ha crecido en la región. Para Edwin es muy importante que su auto tenga todo los repuestos y revisiones en orden para brindar a sus clientes seguridad y comodidad al momento del uso del servicio, es por esto que acudió a Fundación Alternativa para que a través de Kiva le ayuden a financiar varios de los repuestos y arreglos que necesita su auto que es el sustento de su familia a diario. Edwin sueña con un día poder obtener su vivienda propia y ver a su hijo convertido en un profesional destacado, metas que obtendrá con trabajo y esfuerzo y aun sacrificando tiempo con su familia ya que la labor de taxista requiere tiempo extendido en las noches y madrugadas.
texts.en:
Edwin is 28 years old and grew up in a family with limited resources but which nonetheless supported him to finish primary school.  He worked from an early age helping his parents.

Today Edwin is married to Shirley, who is 33 years old and works as a secretary in a photo printing office.  Together they have one son who is still very young and whom they hope to be able to support in his education until he becomes a professional.

Edwin and his family live in the parish of Bomobolí of Santo Domingo, which is the capital city of the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas.  This province has in recent years experienced a high level of sustained growth.  The most attractive and striking aspects of the capital city are its delicious fruits and gastronomy.  It is also a considerable commercial center since it became a land port for commercial trade between the Sierra and Costa regions of the country.  Santo Domingo also has many tourist attractions that, accompanied by its warm climate, are very popular with both national and international tourists. It is for this reason that the majority of the city’s inhabitants have taken up some commercial activity or service directed at the city’s inhabitants and tourists.

Edwin goes all over the city, and at times its outskirts, in his taxi, which he acquired with a lot of effort two years ago.  With the support of his parents, who also are part of a taxi company, Edwin took up this difficult and tiring work in which he works 14 hours a day without a fixed schedule and is exposed to the dangers of the crime that has grown in the region. 

It is very important for Edwin that his car have all of its spare parts and repairs in order so that he can provide his customers security and comfort when they use his service.  It is for this reason that he went to Fundación Alternativa so that through Kiva they could help him finance various spare parts and repairs that his car needs.

Edwin’s taxi is his family’s daily means of support.  He dreams of one day being able to have his own home and to see his son become a distinguished professional.  He believes these are goals he will achieve with hard work and effort, even sacrificing time with his family, since the work of a taxi driver requires extended shifts during the night and early morning.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and perform repairs on his vehicle.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en: Marieta is 30 years old and married with 4 children. She and her husband catch and sell fish, octupus, eel, and other sea creatures in her community or at the market to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Marieta needs a loan to buy another fishing rod, some fishing hooks, goggles, flash light and flippers as well as a canoe. She plans to use her profits to graduate her children from college and build a larger house for her family. Marieta has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy a fishing rod, hooks, goggle, flash light, flippers, etc.

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Patricia tiene 42 años de edad, soltera es estilista profesional pero le gusta más el negocio de la venta de comida, tiene una hija que trabaja como cajera en un banco y estudia por las noches, solicita este crédito para darle mayor presentación a su negocio comprando un exhibidor de comida para brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes con calidad de higiene en los alimentos, el plan a futuro de patricia es poner un comedor en un carro rodante en una pista muy concurrida para obtener mejores ventas.
texts.en: Doña Patricia is 42 years old and single.  She is a professional stylist, but she prefers the food industry.  She has one daughter who works as a bank teller, and goes to school at night.  She is requesting this loan in order to improve her business's appearance by purchasing a food display case to provide better service to her customers with better quality and more hygienic food.  Patricia's future plan is to run a food truck on a busy road for better sales.

loans.use: to purchase a food display case.

loans.name: Kamila

texts.en:
Kamila is 23 years old and single, with three children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows and sell fruits and vegetables in her community or at the market. 

Kamila needs a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, a shovel, fertilizer, weed-killer spray, seedlings, and gardening gloves. She is a new member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2012 and she joined to gain access to financial stability. Kamila hopes to use her earnings to improve her family's assets.

loans.use: to buy gardening tools and supplies.

loans.name: Sweet

texts.en:
Sweet is 21 years old and is single, with no children.  She owns and operates a sewing business venture, sewing and selling to the public to earn a living. She has two and a half years of experience in this line of business. 

Sweet needs a loan to buy a new sewing machine, needle packets, thread, cloth materials, and oil for her machine. She hopes to use her profits to improve her family's assets. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and supplies for her business.

loans.name: Falanika

texts.en:
Falanika is a 38-year-old woman who in a de facto relationship and has three children. She has a small garden where she grows taro (a root crop), taamu (a large root vegetable), yams, and bananas to sell in her community. She has 3 years of experience with this business. 

Falanika has requested a loan to buy more tiapula, a shovel, some bush knives, a rake, axe, and filing with some fertilizer for her plantation. She plans to use her profits to improve her family assets. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy a shovel, bush knives, rake, axe, filing, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Kahonzi

texts.en:
Kahonzi is a resident of Mombasa, in Coast province, Kenya. She is a married mother of seven, and she runs a retail shop selling coconuts. The business has been in operation for 12 years. She began it from her limited savings.

She learned about Milango through one of its employees. She joined with an aim of accessing credit, to improve the operation of her business. Her main business challenge is inflation.

Kahonzi is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings. She will use this amount to buy additional stock of coconuts and packaging bags. She will use the extra income from the loan to set up another business location. She aspires to open a larger trading firm.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of coconuts and packaging bags.

loans.name: Ripine

texts.en: Ripine is 41 year old woman who is married with 5 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu, yams and bananas that she can sell in her community. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Ripine has requested a loan to buy more tiapula (the head of a taro root for replanting), a shovel, some bush knives, a rake, an axe and some fertilizer for her plantation. She plans to use her profits to improve her family's assets. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy more tiapula, a shovel, some bush knives, a rake,  an axe and some fertilizer.

loans.name: Meletino

texts.en: Meletino is a 22 year old woman who is married with 3 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu, yams and bananas that she can sell in her community. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Meletino has requested a loan to buy more tiapula (the head of a taro root for replanting), a shovel, some bush-knives, a rake, an axe and fertilizer for her plantation. She plans to use her profits to improve her family's assets. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy more tiapula, shovels, bush knives, a rake, an axe, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 33 years old and single, with no children. She has a small business, baking and selling pancakes in her community or at the market. 

Luisa needs a loan to buy plastic bags, sugar, flour, yeast, cooking oil, and a gas oven to help her with the business. She is a new member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2012 and joined to gain access to financial services. Luisa hopes to use her earnings to improve her family's assets.

loans.use: to buy a gas oven and baking supplies for her business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 44 years old and married with seven children. She hopes to start a small vegetable garden where she can grow fruits and vegetables to sell in her community or at the market.

Lilia needs a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, a shovel, fertilizer, weed killer spray, seedlings, and gardening gloves. She is a new member of SPBD in 2012 and joined to gain access to financial stability. Lilia hopes to use her earnings to improve her family assets, such as building her children a fixed house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer sack, gardening gloves, shovel, pick, and other items.

loans.name: Saofaigaetoaono

texts.en: Saofaigaetoaono is 27 years old and married with 3 children. She has a small business of baking and selling pancakes in her community or at the market. Saofaiga needs a loan to buy a plastic bags, sugar, flour, yeast, dripping oil and a gas oven to help her with the business. She is a new member of SPBD this year, and joined to gain access to financial services. Saofaiga hopes to use her earnings to improve her family's assets.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags, flour, sugar, yeast, dripping oil, etc.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya, and runs a food cafe. He has been doing this work for 15 years. He is a married father of four children, two of whom are school-going. He is also employed. 

Emmanuel employs four other people in the cafe business, currently. He plans to ease transportation of his food purchases to the business, by buying a motorcycle with the loan funds. He learned of Milango from his friends and is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenyan shillings to purchase the motorcycle for the business. 

Despite the challenges of perishability, high competition and bad debts, Emmanuel aspires to move to a new and larger location, to carry out good business, and to establish a hotel in the future. 

Emmanuel believes the additional income from this loan will help him provide a good education to his children.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commercial use.

loans.name: Lidia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lidia, 48 años de edad, originaria de León, de oficio comerciante, madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos. Ella vende verduras, frutas y carne en las afueras de su casa, este negocio le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia, el financiamiento recibido atravez de los préstamos ha resultado clave para poder surgir cada día.  En esta ocasión está requiriendo el crédito para comprar carne y vender  también para surtir su negocio con frutas y verduras. Poco a poco desea ampliar más su inventario y agregar nuevos productos para vender
texts.en:
48-year old Lidia is a native of León and a businesswoman. She is a single mother with three children. She sells vegetables, fruit, and meat in the neighborhoods around her house. The business has allowed her to help her family get ahead. The money she has received from loans has been key in this progress.

Now Lidia is seeking a loan to buy meat to resell, and also to buy more fruit and vegetables. Her goal is to gradually add more stock so she has new items to offer to her customers.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, fruit and meat

loans.name: Sapi

texts.en:
Sapi is a 40-year-old woman who is married, with three children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu, yams, and bananas that she can sell in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Sapi has requested a loan to buy more tiapula (an underground plant stem that can serve as a storage organ for other plants), a shovel, some bush knives, a rake, an axle and filing, and some fertilizer for her garden. She plans to use her profits to improve her family's assets. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2009.

loans.use: to buy gardening tools and supplies.

loans.name: Wayua

texts.en:
Wayua lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married business lady and a mother of two. Wayua runs a used clothes business, which she has been operating for eight years. In this business she sells shawls, handbags, pants, shoes, etc. She also owns a motorcycle, with which she carries out a transport business.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to a group meeting. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is competition. Wayua is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional stock of second-hand clothing and linens, like bed sheets, shoes and other clothing. 

Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings, to help open a sales stall in the town. Her dream is to open a larger boutique that could provide more income, for the education of her child who is in school.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothing and linens, like bed sheets, shoes and other clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, cinder blocks, sand, and rebar

loans.name: Lupe

texts.en:
Lupe is a 30-year-old woman who is married with one child. She has a small garden where she grows taro (a root crop), taamu (a large root crop), yams, and bananas to sell in her community. She has 2 years of experience with this business.

Lupe has requested a loan to buy more tiapula (the head of a taro root for replanting), a shovel, some bush knives, rake, axe, and filling with some fertilizer for her plantation. She plans to use her profits to improve her family assets. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy more tiapula, shovel, rake, axe, filling, etc.

loans.name: Elise

texts.en:
Elise is 32 years old and married, with two children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows and sells fruits and vegetables in her community or at the market. 

Elise needs a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, a shovel, fertilizer, weed-killer spray, seedlings, and gardening gloves. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2010 and joined to gain access to financial stability. Elise hopes to use her earnings to improve her family's assets.

loans.use: to buy gardening tools and supplies.

loans.name: Wilmer Guillermo

texts.es: Wilmer Guillermo de treinta años de edad vive junto a su madre y su hermano en casa propia, el posee una ciber café, tiene varios años de experiencia en el negocio y eso le ha dado la oportunidad de obtener siempre las mejores ganancias, el ciber café esta ubicado en un lugar que califico como bueno para su trabajo y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque tiene el mejor servicio de la zona además tiene los mejores precios; Wilmer es un hombre entregado a su labor, dispuesto a dar todo de su parte para cumplir sus sueños lo mas impórtate en su vida es su familia y en las ultimas semanas el deterioro de su vivienda ha incomodado la tranquilidad del hogar, la casa necesita reparaciones y quiere realizarlas lo mas pronto posible para la seguridad de todos, su mas grande secreto es la perseverancia, sabe que así alcanzara el éxito, necesita invertir pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, ladrillos, tejas, herramientas etc. Wilmer Guillermo tiene buenas referencias de pago y se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda, a la vez tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Wilmer Guillermo is 30-years old and lives together with this mother and his brother in their own home.  He has a cyber cafe.  He has a number of years of experience in the business, which has given him the chance to earn a good income.  The cyber cafe is in a good location, and Wilmer has a lot of customers.  People prefer his cyber cafe because he offers the best service in the area and the best prices.  Wilmer is man who is committed to his work.  He is ready to give his all to make his dreams come true.  The most important thing in his life is his family.  In recent weeks, the deterioration of his home has affected his family's tranquility.  The house needs repairs, and Wilmer wants to make them as soon as possible for the safety of his family.  Wilmer's greatest secret is his perseverance.  He knows that he will be successful.  He needs to invest, but he doesn't have enough capital.  And so he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow him to buy cement, bricks, tile, tools etc.  Wilmer Guillermo is a good credit risk and will be responsible in paying back the loan.  He also has faith that he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, tile and tools.

loans.name: Dúo Sagrado Corazon De Santo Tomas Group

texts.es:
dúo Sagrado Corazón de Santo Tomas
Este dúo está conformado por doña Vilma Judith, ella tiene 28 años de edad y dos niños , ella de dedica a la venta de medicina para enfermos renales, de forma ambulante en la ciudad de Guatemala especialmente en las afueras de los Hospitales de Guatemala, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de medicamentos y compra de ponchos ya que en esta temporada fría aprovecha venderlos de la misma forma, su anhelo es llegar a tener una farmacia pero para eso menciona que se necesita mucho capital deseo y esperanza es lograrlo.
texts.en:
One of the Sacred Heart of Saint Thomas women is 28-year old Vilma Judith. She has two children. She earns her living selling medication for kidney complaints in the streets of the town of Guatemala, especially outside the local hospitals.

Vilma is seeking a loan so she can buy more medicines and also some ponchos as in the cold season she could sell them at the same time.

Her dream is to have a pharmacy but she knows this will require a lot of money. Her wish and hope is that she will one day fulfill her dream.

loans.use: To buy medicines

loans.name: Patricia Rufina

texts.es: La Sra. Patricia sigue con la misma actividad de confección de ropa, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito y en esta ocasión esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de tela para la confección de  prendas de vestir ya que para esta época de carnavales tiene mucho trabajo y tiene pedidos que entregar.
texts.en: Patricia continues to make clothes. Her previous loan went really well. Now that it is Carnival season and she has a lot of work and orders to complete, she is requesting a loan to buy fabric to make articles of clothing.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make clothes.

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es:
María, de 28 años de edad, es una humilde comerciante quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, casada, madre de 5 hijos, ella debido a su condiciones de pobreza en la cual fue criada solo finalizo la primaria, y es por lo cual no quiere que sus hijos tengan el mismo futuro. Ella inicio con su pequeño negocio a los 19 años de edad, necesitaba un medio del  cual subsistir y poder ser independiente generando ingresos por sí misma. Sus comienzos fueron muy difícil su horno de leña, solo dos sartenes, un quintal de harina y sus humildes manos trabajadoras empezaron la difícil tarea de vender pan con muy pocos recursos. Actualmente ella junto con su esposo han logrado mantener el negocio estable, vende de manera ambulante apoyándose de bicicletas para salir a vender el pan calientito y listo para el desayuno de sus clientes. 
Su expectativa es que su negocio crezca y poder dar empleo a más personas, ofrecer variedad en repostería. Está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar harina, aceite, azúcar, sartenes, levadura, manteca.
texts.en:
María, 28, is a modest merchant who makes a living making and selling bread.  She's married and the mother of five children.  Because of the poverty in which she was raised, she only finished elementary school.  This is why she doesn't want her children to have the same future.

She started her small business at the age of 19.  She needed a means of support to be independent and generate an income for herself.  Her beginning was very difficult.  She started the difficult task of selling bread with very few resources, only her wood-burning stove, two pans, a quintal of flour, and her humble hands.

Currently she and her husband have managed to keep the business stable.  She sells on foot, relying on bicycles to go out and sell the piping hot bread, ready for her customers' breakfasts.

Her hope is that her business will grow and she'll be able to employ more people, to offer a variety of baked goods.  She needs the loan to buy flour, oil, sugar, pans, yeast, and shortening.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, sugar, pans, yeast, and shortening

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a resident of the Malindi area of Coast province, Kenya. She is the mother of two children. Mwanasha owns a food stall, a business that she has been running for about seven years. She sells, for example, cooked potatoes, beverages and buns. Her main challenges have been bad debts and the high cost of food stock.

She learned about Milango from its employee. She joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of her business. Mwanasha is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to pay her child's school fees, and also to purchase food ingredients, like cooking fat, wheat flour and sugar. 

The extra income earned with the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standard of the family, especially the education of her children. She aspires to be own a hotel in the future.

loans.use: to pay her child's school fees, and also to buy food ingredients, like cooking fat, flour, and grains.

loans.name: Cristo Nos Guia Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Cristo Nos Guía está conformado por 11 integrantes, todas madres solteras con 18 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Estas mujeres se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Ella han tenido que trabajar desde muy joven, ya que por falta de recursos económicos para apoyar a sus padres con su trabajo físico. Son originarias de Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del  país. Todas se apoyan mutuamente con sus diferentes actividades económicas.  Juana Francisca es la coordinadora del banco comunal Cristo nos guía y se encarga de la responsabilidad de las integrantes del banco en cuanto a las cuotas en tiempo y forma, ella tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general la cual consisten en la compra y venta de pantalones, blusas, faldas, short, camisetas, camisolas, ropa interior, ropa de cama, pijamas. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, y en un futuro no muy lejano aumentar su ingresos. El banco comunal agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank Cristo Nos Guia (Christ Guides Us) consists of 11 members, all single mothers with 18 children under their responsibility. These women are characterized by being hard-working and responsible with the personal will to overcome. They have had to work since they were very young, since due to the lack of economic resources, they had to help their parents with their physical labor. They are natives of Sauce, a place that is located in the northern part of the country. All of them are mutually supportive with their different economic activities. 

Juana Francisca is the coordinator of the communal bank Cristo Nos Guia, and she has the responsibility for the members of the bank with regard to [making] the payments on time and in the correct form. Her business activity is the sale of merchandise in general, which consists of buying and selling pants, blouses, skirts, shorts, t-shirts, camisoles, underwear, nightwear, and pajamas. Her goal for the loan is to invest in working capital and meet the demands of her customers and in the not-too-distant future increase her income. 

The communal bank is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of scarce economic resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to stock her business with merchandise such as pants, blouses, skirts, shorts, t-shirts, camisoles, underwear, nightwear, and pajamas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, blocks and iron for the addition of a room.

loans.name: Faaleaga

texts.en:
Faaleaga is 34 years old and married, with four children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows and sells fruits and vegetables in her community or at the market. 

Faaleaga needs a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, a shovel, fertilizer, weed-killer spray, seedlings, and gardening gloves. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2010 and joined to gain access to financial stability. Faaleaga hopes to use her earnings to improve her family's assets.

loans.use: to buy gardening tools and supplies.

loans.name: Dúo Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
DÚO GUADALUPE
ESTA FORMADO POR LA INTEGRANTE MAYRA DE 32 AÑOS DE EDAD  HACE 3 AÑOS QUE INICIO SU NEGOCIO ESTA MUY CONTENTA POR LA FORMA DE PAGO QUE FAPE LE BRINDO Y LOS INTERES QUE SON DE MASIADOS BAJOS ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS POR CATALOGO(COSMETICOS)LE DA GRACIAS A DIOS POR HABERLE DADO LA OPORTUNIDAD DE SU NEGOCIO AHORA ELLA ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE MAS MERCADERIAS HEN PRODUCTOS POR CATALOGO(COSMETICOS.
texts.en: Mayra, who is 32-years old, is a member of the DÚO GUADALUPE communal bank.  She started her business three years ago.  She is very happy about the payment plan Fape offered her as well as the interest rate, which is very low.  She makes her living selling catalog products (cosmetics).  She thanks god for giving her this business opportunity.  Mayra is requesting the loan to purchase additional catalog merchandise (cosmetics).

loans.use: to purchase more catalog merchandise (cosmetics).

loans.name: Katia Elizabeth

texts.es: Katia Elizabeth de treinta y uno años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos; ella se dedica a la  venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, posee en variedad camisas, faldas, vestidos, pantalones entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias; comercia de forma ambulante y desde su hogar, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles, con producto de calidad y con un servicio excelente; Katia es una mujer emprendedora y muy dedicada a su labor, siempre esta luchando por lo que desea y no piensa rendirse hasta alcanzar el éxito que se merece, en los últimos meses aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. Katia elizabetn tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Katia Elizabeth is 31 years old and lives with her life companion and their children. She sells clothing for women, men, and children. Katia offers a great variety of shirts, skirts, dresses, and pants among other items. She has been in business for several years and has gained plenty of experience, allowing her to make a good profit. She sells her products on the street and from her home. She has built a solid clientele who prefer to buy from her because she always has what they need at affordable prices. She offers quality products and excellent service.  

Katia is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work. She always fights for her dreams and she refuses give up until she becomes successful. In the past few months demand has increased and she wants to take advantage to make a new investment. However, because she does not have the capital to back her up, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy clothing in bulk. Katia Elizabeth has a good history of making payments and is very responsible. She is certain that she will be able to settle the debt. She also trusts this will bring her family economic security.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk

loans.name: Teresita De Jesus

texts.es: Teresita, 54 años de edad, originaria de León , se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante ,lleva más de 10 años dedicándose a este negocio . Su esposo también le ayuda a vender ropa, zapatos, sombrillas, sabanas, chinelas y diferentes artículos para el hogar. Ambos se apoyan para salir adelante. Está solicitando el crédito para comprar pantalones, camisas, shorts, cosméticos. Su propósito es abrir nueva ruta de ventas en las afueras de la ciudad y poner su propia tienda de mercadería en general.
texts.en: Teresita is 54 years old and is a native of Leon.  She has been selling clothing as a street vendor for over 10 years.  Her husband helps her to sell clothing, shoes, umbrellas, sheets, slippers and different household items.  They support one another in their efforts to get ahead.  She is requesting this loan in order to purchase pants, shirts, shorts and cosmetics.  Her purpose is to open new sales routes in the outskirts of the city, and to open her own merchandise store.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, shorts and cosmetics.

loans.name: Edgar Benito

texts.es: Edgar es casado, tiene tres  hijos de los cuales uno ya termino la secundaria y los otros dos estudian en una escuela cerca de su casa, tiene una distribuidora de cubrecamas, cortinas y línea blanca ( licuadoras, ollas, planchas) el inicio su negocio hace aproximadamente diez años y gracias a Dios han ido incrementando las ventas, el solicita el crédito ya que en estas fechas las ventas aumentan y las ganancias también, el esta muy contenta en trabajar con fape por los beneficios que obtiene con el préstamo.esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos de usos domesticos.
texts.en: Edgar is married and has three children one of which has completed secondary school and the other two attend a local school near his house.  He distributes bedspreads, curtains and small home appliances (blenders, pots, irons).  He started his business about 10 years ago and thanks to God his sales have been increasing.  He’s requesting the loan because sales increase these days as do profits.  He’s very happy to work with FAPE because of the benefits he gets from the loans.  He’s asking for this loan to buy some home use products.

loans.use: to buy home products.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: La Sra. Carolina tiene 52 años, casada con dos hijos que son de las edades de de 3 y 7 años,  el se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, su panadería  que se encuentra ubicado  en la localidad de Pedro Lorenzo,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Carolina va a usar este préstamo para la compra de  un horno de mayor capacidad ya quiere incrementar su producción y así satisfacer la demandada de sus clientes, La Sra. Carolina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia de una panadería que produce en mayor cantidad,  con este crédito mejorara sus ganancias, La Sra. Carolina es una persona  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en: Mrs. Carolina is 52 years old and married with two children who are 3 and 7 years old.  She bakes and sells bread at her bakery which is located in Pedro Lorenzo.  This loan is her first with this institution.  Carolina intends to use this loan to purchase an oven with a higher capacity because she wants to increase her production, and by doing so satisfy her customers' demand.  Carolina faces challenges in her business, including the competition of a bakery that produces bread in larger quantities.  With this loan, her revenue will increase.  Carolina is a person with a desire to excel.  She is happy with and thankful for the institution's support as this is the only activity that allows her to survive.

loans.use: to purchase an oven.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a resident of Malindi, Kenya, and a married father of one school-going child. He is a farmer and has been in the business for five years. He normally cultivates tomatoes, brinjals (also known as aubergines, or eggplant) and other vegetables. Samuel is also employed.

He was introduced to Milango by his friends. Samuel is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to purchase fertilizers and seedlings to plant. He intends to save the additional income for future projects. His main ambition is to increase the acreage of the farm, or the area under cultivation. Samuel believes this will help improve his standard of living, especially as it relates to the education of his child.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, and seedlings to plant.

loans.name: Juana  Aracelly

texts.es:
Juana, 41 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León, madre de tres hijos, de oficio comerciante se dedica a vender comida y ropa usada. Es un cliente Kiva,  está muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado porque poco a poco gracias al financiamiento obtenido ha ido creciendo como comerciante, apoyado a sus hijos a salir  adelante.
Está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, vegetales, pollo, empaques para comida. Uno de sus propósitos  a realizar es ir mejorando la infraestructura de su negocio.
texts.en: Juana is 41 years old, lives in the city of León and is the mother of three children.  She is a merchant who sells food and used clothing.  She is a client of Kiva, and is very grateful for their support because little by little, thanks to the funding she has received, she has been able to grow as a merchant and support her children to succeed.  She is requesting this loan in order to purchase rice, sugar, oil, vegetables, chicken and food packaging.  One of the purposes for this is to continue improving the infrastructure of her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, vegetables, chicken, and packaging for food.

loans.name: Santos Margarito

texts.es:
El señor Santos Margarito  está casado, tiene 53 años de edad, cursó solamente los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales algunos están graduado y otros siguen estudiando, se dedica a la talabartería, la elaboración de calzado para damas, inicio este siendo operador para otro negocio y hasta el momento lleva 16 años de experiencia y ha tenidos éxito, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quienes dedica al comercio a la venta de calzados que elabora su esposo.

Esta solicitando un préstamo que lo  utilizara para a la compra de materiales, pieles, cuerina, pegamento, adornos, etc, necesarios para aumentar su producción y tener mejores estilos para  sus clientes, esperando el futuro tenga más clientes y ofrezca mejores diseños a la moda actual de su región.
texts.en:
Santos Margarito is married.  He’s 53-years-old and only completed third grade in elementary school. He has 8 children some of which have graduated and others are still in school.  He works as a cobbler making women’s shoes.  He started out as an employee in another firm and to date has 16 years’ experience and has been successful.  He has his wife’s support who works in commerce selling the shoes her husband makes.

He’s requesting a loan to buy supplies like leather, faux leather, glue, decorations, etc. needed to increase production and to have better styles for his customers hoping to acquire more customers in future and to offer better designs that are in up-to-date styles in the region.

loans.use: to buy materials for working with leather.

loans.name: Sivaolei

texts.en: Sivaolei is a 20-year-old married woman with no children. She would like to start growing taro, bananas, yams and taamu to earn a living. Sivaolei has requested a loan to buy chemicals, knapsack weed sprayer, an axe, a spade and a file. She will spend her profits to improve her family assets.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, bush knives and spade etc

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena de 41 años casada tiene una hija ya de 11 años, se dedica a la venta de consumo diario, vende golosinas, gaseosas, jugos, arroz, frijol, maíz, pastas, una variedad de productos, ya desde hace 12 años, empezó a vender pollo también, y es un ingreso mayor, también emplea a una señorita para que  la ayude dos veces a ala semana cuando ella asiste a su iglesia, esta feliz por los resultados y las Bendiciones en su vida y negocio, espera seguir creciendo y ayudar a su esposo con la economía de su hogar y a su hija quien ya inicia ciclo básico, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles.
texts.en: María Elena, 41, has an 11-year-old daughter.  She sells daily consumption items like snacks, soft-drinks, juices, rice, beans, corn, pastas and a variety of other products.  She’s been in business 12 years.  She started to sell chicken too which adds to her income.  She hires a young lady to help her twice a week when she attends church.  She’s happy with the results and with the blessings she’s had in her life and business and hopes to continue growing to help her husband with household economy and her daughter who has started basic schooling.  She’s asking for the loan to buy food items.

loans.use: to buy food items.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu is 36 years old and married with three children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows and sells fruits and vegetables in her community or at the market. Fatu needs a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, a shovel, fertilizer, weed killer spray, seedlings and gardening gloves. She is a new member of SPBD this year (2012) and joined to gain access to financial stability. Fatu hopes to use her earnings to improve her family's assets.

loans.use: to buy a new wheelbarrow, a shovel, fertilizer, weed killer spray, seedlings and gardening gloves

loans.name: Leafa

texts.en: Leafa is 32 years old and married with five children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows and sells fruits and vegetables in her community or at the market. Leafa needs a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, a shovel, fertilizer, weed killer spray, seedlings and gardening gloves. She is a new member of SPBD this year (2012) and joined to gain access to financial stability. Leafa hopes to use her earnings to improve her family's assets.

loans.use: to buy a new wheelbarrow, a shovel, fertilizer, weed killer spray, seedlings and gardening gloves

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en: Miriama is a 25-year-old married woman with one child. She would like to start growing taro, bananas, yams and taamu (a root vegetable like taro) to earn a living. Miriama has requested a loan to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, filings and a crowbar for the plantation. Miriama will spend her profits to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, filings and a crowbar for her plantation.

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina tiene 66 años, poco después de contraer matrimonio sufrió la pérdida de su esposo con quien tenía muchos planes, desde aquel entonces ha logrado educar a sus hijos Daniel y Joel quienes ya mayores gozan de una buena ocupación laboral. Reside en una vivienda construida a base de adobe. Es propietaria de unas parcelas cuya producción básica es el café y achiote. Anteriormente poseía un negocio de abarrotes pero le fue mal debido a la poca demanda.
Se desempeña como productora agraria, empezó desde muy niña logrando independizarse a los 18 años gracias a una herencia material por parte de sus padres.
Se siente a gusto con su labor ya que gracias a sus ganancias logro sola sustentar su economía familiar.
Al iniciarse la temporada lluviosa en la zona desea dejar en manos de jornaleros el respectivo sembrío de achiote y café para el cual debe contar con capital suficiente.
Otro de los requerimientos necesario para un producción de calidad es la compra de abono orgánico cuya demanda actual permite obtenerlo a un precio módico y así realizar un abono integral de sus parcelas.
Uno de sus motivos de esfuerzo posterior a sus hijos es la construcción de su vivienda a base de ladrillos y cemento con el objetivo de alquilarlo y tener un ingreso fijo mensual para su vejez. Desea contar con 4,000 nuevos soles para el anticipo del pago a los jornaleros y la compra de sacos guano de isla para iniciar la producción de café y achiote en el inicio de la temporada lluviosa en la zona.
texts.en:
Albina, 66, lost her husband shortly after they were married; they had made many plans together and since then she’s managed to educate her children Daniel and Joel who now have good jobs.  She lives in an adobe house and owns some parcels of land where the main crops are coffee and annatto.  She used to have a grocery store but did poorly due to limited demand.
