La señora Emiliana es madre soltera, tiene 24 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 2 hijos pequeños, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa nueva y usada, ropa típica para mujeres en la plaza de comunidad, inicio este negocio con el fin de mejorar su condición de vida y tener un negocio estable, hasta el momento lleva 7 años de experiencia.


Organiza un grupo de señoras y solicita un prestamos que lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería, consistente en cortes, blusas, fajas, sabanas, etc, espera seguir mejorando su negocio, ya que el el futuro tendrá un negocio amplio. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica al comercio de ropa nueva y usada también. 2 de las personas en la fotos no calificaron  para un crédito.
texts.en:
Emiliana is a single mother who is 24 years old.  She didn’t have the opportunity to attend school.  She has two small children.  She makes a living in the business of selling new and used clothing and traditional clothing for women in the community market.  She started this business with the goal of improving her living conditions and having a stable business.  To date she has seven years of experience.

She has organized a group of woman and she is requesting a loan that she will use to buy merchandise which consists of traditional woven skirts, blouses, waist sashes, blankets, etc.   She hopes to continue improving her business so that in the future she will have a large business.  

The rest of the members of the group also make a living in the business of selling new and used clothing.  Two of the people in the photo did not qualify for a loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as skirts, blouses, sashes, blankets, etc.

loans.name: Nebah

texts.en:
He is married and has two children below the age of 15. They live in a two-room apartment in Bamenda in the northwest region of Cameroon.
 
He has encountered problems including the death of his father, a sickness that required an operation, the sickness of his daughter and a recent accident. Inadequate finance to start a business and provide square meals to his children and to cater to their education is also a challenge.

With the new loan, he plans to purchase fuel wood for resale, fowls and their feed, and planks for his wood workshop expansion. He believes this his business will succeed because he has being keeping fowls for a long time, he is also a trained carpenter, there is high demand for fuel wood in the community, and he has a good business site and also regular customers who buy from him. 

The community will benefit because they will not go a long distance to buy wood. He will also produce chairs, beds, and repairs for the public.

The profits will help him in improving the housing conditions of the family, providing better education for the family and expanding his business. He prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the convenient repayment period, low interest and the social education they provide.

loans.use: to purchase fuel wood for resale, fowls, and planks to expand his carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 41 years old and married with five children ages four, six, eight, ten, and 12. For the past seven years, she has been buying and reselling scrap metal in the Bomet area. Gladys earns a monthly income of 24,500 KES. 

Gladys is requesting a 30,000 KES loan through KADET LTD to purchase additional metal for her business. This will be her second loan. Gladys will use the anticipated profit from her loan to provide for her family's basic needs. In the future, she hopes to diversify her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metal

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en: Cristy is 37 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. Cristy lives in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, where she has earned a living for the last 5 years by selling home and used products. She makes 15,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month and is applying for a loan for 25,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. Cristy joined GDMPC in 2011 as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Enrique's primary source of income comes from farming, planting and harvesting rice to sell. He had been in the business for over 10 years. Enrique is now 40 years old and married to Mary Ann who works abroad. They have two children attending to school.

Enrique is a responsible father and wanted to give the best education to his children. He is now asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy insecticides and fertilizers, and to pay for farm labor. He hopes to keep acquiring abundant harvests that will lead to additional income for the sustenance of his family. He promises to pay back his loan in full.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and fertilizers, and to pay labor cost in farming

loans.name: Margarita Del Carmen

texts.es: Margarita del Carmen de cuarenta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su nieto; ella se dedica a la venta de comida desayunos y almuerzos como tamales, huevos, frijoles, sopas, carnes, ensaladas entre otros; tiene varios años con el negocio y  eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias; comercia en un lugar que califico como muy bueno para sus actividades y es muy conocida por todas las personas de la comunidad pues prepara las comidas mas deliciosas de la zona, ya tiene mucha clientela fija que la prefiere porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a buen precio y sobre todo con un servicio excelente; Margarita es una mujer activa, emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y siempre dispuesta a luchar por encontrar las mejores alternativas que le abran camino al éxito, su mas grande secreto es el esfuerzo y el amor al trabajo sabe que solo así cumplirá su objetivo, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INNTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz, pollos, verduras, carne, huevos, bebidas, etc. Margarita del Carmen tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Margarita del Carmen is forty-seven years of age and lives with her life partner and her grandson.  She earns her living selling meals: breakfasts and lunches such as tamales, eggs, beans, soups, meat dishes and salads, among other things.  She has been running the business for a number of years and, through it, has gained plenty of sales experience, which allows her to make bigger profits.  She plies her trade in a place which she considers very favourable for her business and she is well known throughout her community for preparing the most delicious dishes in the area.  She now has a large regular clientele who prefer her because she sells only goods of the highest quality, prices them reasonably and, above all, delivers excellent service. 

Margarita is busy, enterprising, dedicated to her work and always willing to strive to find the best opportunities for success.  Her greatest secret is hard work and love of the job which, she knows, are the only ways to achieve her ambition.  

In recent weeks demand has increased and she wants to capitalise on this by making a new investment.  To do this she needs capital and is, therefore, seeking an INTEGRAL loan to buy corn, chickens, vegetables, meat, eggs, drinks, etc.  Margarita del Carmen has good repayment references and is highly responsible.  She guarantees that she will be able to repay her debts and, at the same time, is confident that she can provide a full life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, chickens, vegetables, meat, eggs and drinks

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio, 30 years of age, is married and has one child. 

He has had a motor spare parts retailing business for almost one year. 

He is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 40,000 to purchase additional motor parts to sell. His monthly net income is PHP 10,000. His profits are used to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase motor spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 44 years old and is married. She had three children who are studying. She is engaged in growing and selling vegetables in the village. Aside from this business, she also has a hog-raising business. 

To cover the needs of her businesses, she is asking for PHP 5,000 to buy vegetable seeds and feed for her hog. She hopes that she can gain more income now that could let her save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hog and vegetable seeds to plant.

loans.name: Habonaya

texts.en:
Habonaya is a 37-year-old charcoal dealer in Tudor, Mombasa. She is a widow who has been in this business for the last four years. 

She is requesting her second loan to buy more stock of charcoal for sale. 

She supports three children and has a great income. She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children. Her previous loan was paid successfully and she hopes to uplift her business and have a well maintained family in future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Neba

texts.en:
She is married and blessed with six children, two below the age of 15. They live in a four room apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West region of Cameroon. She has encountered so many challenges in life such as death, sickness, at times no support, illness of her children, inadequate finance to start up business, providing square meals to her children and paying for her children's education.

With the new loan, she plans to purchase articles which are provision items like beans, rice, plantains, cocoyam. The rest of the loan will be used to buy fowl and the feed needed for the upkeep of the fowl. She believes her business will succeed because of her longevity in the business and the high demand for food stuff such as beans and yams in the community. She has a good business site and also regular customers who buy from her for resale and restaurants. The community will benefit because they will not go long distance to buy food items.

The profits will help her increase her business, provide better education for the family and expand her business. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the convenient repayment period, low interest and the social education they provide.

loans.use: purchase beans, provision items, plantains, fowl, and cocoyam.

loans.name: Rieza Jane

texts.en:
Rieza Jane, age 24, is married with 1 child. She is from Bunawan, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Rieza Jane manages a retail business where she sells a variety of meat and food products for a living. The work gives her a total monthly income of 10,000 PHP. 

In 2012, she joined GDMPC. Rieza Jane has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP from the cooperative to purchase additional products like seasonings, meats, etc. She hopes to spare a portion of her earnings for maintenance costs and to expand her current offerings.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like seasonings, meats, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Otgon

texts.en:
Mrs. Otgon is 38 years old and lives with her husband, daughter and her mother in a Ger (Mongolian housing tent) in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband, Erdenechuluun, is working at a construction site in Ulaanbaatar temporarily. Her daughter, Enhzaya, age 15, goes to a local secondary school. Her mother stays home. 

Otgon has been running her animal hides and pelt retail business since 2000. She has a lot of experience and a large network within the business. She is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase a large amount of animal pelt and hides since this is the high season in which locals purchase meat in large quantities. She is a hardworking and well-experienced woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of animal pelts and hides since this is the high season in which locals purchase meat in large quantities.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cloth and thread to make sofa covers.

loans.name: Ambe

texts.en:
Ambe is married and has ten children, three of whom are under the age of fifteen. The family lives in a ten-room apartment in Bamenda North West region of Cameroon. Ambe has encountered many challenges in life, including the death of his first daughter and his father. When he lost his job, it was like the world was coming to an end. Inadequate financing to start up a business, provide square meals to his children and pay for their education is also a problem.

With the new loan, Ambe plans to purchase piglets, construct a modern pigsty, and buy feed for the pigs. He believes that his business will succeed because he has being keeping pigs for a long time, the demand for piglets and pork meat in the community is high, and he has a good business site and regular customers who buy from him for resale and restaurants. The community will benefit because they will not have to go a long distance to buy good piglets and matter for their farm use.

The profits will help Ambe improve the housing conditions of his family, provide better education for his children and expand his project. He prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the convenient repayment period, low interest and the social education GHAPE provides.

loans.use: purchase piglets and construct a pigsty.

loans.name: Amalina

texts.en:
Amalina raises her six children through her profits from her sari-sari store business. She is 52 years old and is married. Her husband operates their tricycle for passengers’ transportation. She successfully sent her children to college. They finished their education and now have their own jobs.

Amalina wishes to maintain her good health and be able to run the business until she can do it. She doesn’t want to rely on her children for remittance, that’s why she is running the business for their future. 

Amalina is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy grocery items like canned goods, snack foods and drinks to sell in their village. She hopes to maintain the business and earn income for the future of her husband.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like canned goods, snack foods and drinks to sell in their village.

loans.name: Tsogt

texts.en:
Borrower Mr. Tsogt is 50 years old, married and lives with his family in a small apartment in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. He has a son and a daughter, both of them are employed. His spouse is a retired accountant. Now she stays at home, since she walks with a stick.  

Since 2010, Mr. Tsogt has run a taxi business and supports his family by operating this business. Recently, his mother had a serious illness so his family needs money for her treatment. This loan will be used for his mother’s treatment fee. Tsogt’s short term wish is to quickly treat his mother.

loans.use: to treat his very old-age mother.

loans.name: Vutsile

texts.en:
Vutsile is married and has six children, five of them below the age of fifteen. They live in a six-room apartment in Bamenda North West region of Cameroon. 

Vutsile has faced challenges in life which includes inadequate finance to start up a business and providing square meals for his children. Catering to his children's education is also a problem.

With this new loan, Vutsile will purchase piglets, construct a modern pig pen, and buy three bags of feed for the pigs. He believes this his business will succeed because he has being keeping pigs for a long time, there is a high demand for piglets and pork meat in the community, he has a good business site, and also regular customers who buy from him for resale and for a restaurant. The community will benefit because they will not have to go long distances to buy good piglets and manure for their farm use.

The profits will help Vutsile to improve the housing conditions of the family, provide better education for the family, and expand his business. He prefers a loan from Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) because of the convenient repayment period, low interest, and the social education they provide.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed and construct a pig pen.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is 41 years old. She operates a piggery that she wants to improve. She is married and has three school-aged children. Her family’s expenses have abruptly increased, so Flordeliza is aiming to make a higher profit. Because of this, Marites is asking a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes that through her loan, she will provide enough nourishment to her pigs to sell them at a high price. If this happens, she will be able to cover her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Enjeh

texts.en:
She is a widow with two children and they live in a two-bedroom house in the Bamenda Mezam division of the northwest region of Cameroon.
 
She has faced so many challenges in life, including inadequate finance to educate her children, sickness, death and downfall in business. The death of her son was not easy in her life, and a few months later her husband also passed away.

With the new loan requested, she will expand her business by buying more fowls, constructing a new place for the fowls, buying drinkers and feeders, and the rest of the loan will be used to buy vaccine for the fowls. She will use part of the loan to buy feed in bags. 

She believes this business will succeed because of her longevity in the business and the high demand for fowls in town because of the increasing population. This business will help the community to benefit from a regular supply of fowls at moderate prices.
 
With the profit from the loan she will plough back, provide some basic items for her children's education and add more rooms to her house. She prefers GHAPE loans because interest rates are low, members are educated on loan management before the loans are disbursed and the repayment intervals are convenient.

loans.use: to purchase day-old-chicks and expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Ghulam's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam is a 19-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband. Her husband rents out chairs, tables, flowers, lights, and other decoration items for different occasions like: wedding ceremonies, birthday parties, and meetings. They have no children. Ghulam is a very hard-working and independent woman. She helps her husband in the business. 

Ghulam, as a member of five-person lending group (Ghulam's Group), has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, she will be purchasing some more chairs, tents, flowers, etc. for her husband's decoration business. 

Since she is living in a rented house with her family, she dreams to build her own house. She also desires to increase her business. Ghulam and her husband are very much thankful to both BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

Note: In the picture Ghulam holds a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, tents, flowers, etc. for her husband's decoration business.

loans.name: Vierlito

texts.en: Vierlito's main source of income comes from his hog raising business. He is 43 years old and single. He is from Unidos, Plaridel and been in the hog raising business for 2 years, earning 10,000 PHP a month. Recently, Vierlito joined GDMPC. Vierlito is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings for his business.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Through the hog-fattening business, Editha, aged 41, can send her children to school to finish their education. She wishes for them to become professionals someday. She believes that education will lead them out of poor living. This causes Editha to do all that she can to boost her business.

Now, she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy feeds and vitamins for her hogs. She hopes that the loan will be a great help in improving her income in order to diminish the financial restraint they are experiencing.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for the pigs.

loans.name: Jasmine

texts.en:
For over two years in Tipolo, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Jasmine, a 26-year-old married mother of two children, has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2012, Jasmine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo (malted milk), shampoo, and soaps. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, and soaps.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
She is married and blessed with four children, two below the age of 15. They live in a three-room apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West region of Cameroon. 

She has encountered so many challenges in life, including the death of her mother, the death of one of her children and inadequate finance to start a business and sponsor her children's education.

With the new loan, she plans to purchase provision items such as beans, rice, tin tomatoes, vegetable oil and magi to sell. Part of the loan will be invested in farming and in buying seedlings. She also plans to buy smoked fish in cartons to sell.  

She believes the business will succeed because of her longevity in the business. Also, the demand for foods such as rice and other provision items is high in the community. She has a good business site and also regular customers who buy from her for resale and restaurant. The community will benefit because they will not go a long distance to buy her items, especially smoked fish.

The profits will help her expand her business and provide better education for the family. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the convenient repayment period, low interest and the social education they provide.

loans.use: to purchase provision items and smoked fish to sell and seedlings to plant.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en: Jerry, aged 36, is blessed with three children. This causes him to work hard to provide for them. He is in the transportation business. He transports passengers every day. Now he is taking a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to purchase new tires for his vehicle and to pay for maintenance. Hopefully, he can provide a better living for his family.

loans.use: to purchase new tires and pay for maintenance for his vehicle

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is married with three children and they live in a two-room apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, among which are accidents of family members, thus, making her spend the little time she has on drugs, also sickness, stress over the death of her parents, and limited funds to educate her children and meet the rising demands of their needs. 

With the new loan requested, Angeline promises to expand her poultry farm by buying more piglets, chicks, animal feed, and seedlings and to rent farm land. She is very positive her business will succeed because she has regular customers who buy her farm output and ready animals for sale, she has experience in the business, and the demand of such products creates her demand in the area. With this activity, the community will benefit from manure which will fertilize their farms, thus, leading to high yields; products will be sold to them at moderate prices.

With the profit from the loan, Angeline will pay her children's school fees and provide their basic needs; she will expand her business by buying more animals for her poultry farm, and also provide medication. To her, Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) loans are preferable because loans are given without collateral and on limited interest rates.

loans.use: to expand her farm.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has four children. For the past 15 years, Annet has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells drinks such as beer, lemonade, wine and spirits. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more drinks to sell, such as beer, lemonade, and wine. The loan will help Annet to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a restaurant. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Annet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more drinks such as beer, lemonade, and wine to sell.

loans.name: Ichinkhorloo

texts.en:
Borrower Ichinkhorloo is a married 38-year-old woman who lives with her family in an outer ger district that lacks the basic infrastructure of the city. She works as a maid at a local high school. She has three girls who attend kindergarten, high school, and a higher education institute.

Ichinkhorloo is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) to pay her eldest daughter's tuition fees, and to buy a PC and printer which are really needed for her daughter's studies.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fees and to buy a PC and printer for her daughter's studies.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 28-years-old woman in Kiembeni, Mombasa. She is married and together with the husband who supports her, they have four children. 
She has been in this business for the last one year and she is doing well. She will use the requested loan to purchase a stock of dried small fish for sale and will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Being her first loan, she hopes to be successful in her business and to prosper further.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of dried small fish for sale.

loans.name: Mbabe

texts.en:
Mbabe is married and has six children. They live in a three-bedroom house in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. 
She has faced many challenges in life, which include inadequate finance to educate her children, so the children are frequently driven out of school for lack of school fees, basic text books, and other items like pens, pencils and books.
With the new loan she has requested, she will expand her business by buying more food items like cocoyams (taro), palm oil, tomatoes, maggi and other spices to help her carry out the proper operation of her restaurant. She strongly believes that her business will succeed, because of her longevity and experience in the business, as well as high demand in the locality. She says her business will benefit the community by providing a regular supply of food at moderate prices, and because food is supplied for ceremonial activities like weddings, birthday parties and death memorials at reduced prices.
She will plough back the profit from the loan into the business, provide some basic items for her children’s education, and add more rooms to her house. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates, because members are educated on loan management before the loans are disbursed, and because the repayment terms are affordable.

loans.use: to buy cocoyams (taro), palm oil, maggi and other spices, and soap for her restaurant.

loans.name: Randy

texts.en: Randy is 24 years of age, married, and blessed with two children. His source of everyday income is buying and selling vegetables. His business is currently in need of additional funds to buy more vegetables to sell in the village. So Randy is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy string beans, cabbage, squash and gabi (taro). With these funds and his hard work, he knows that he will earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy string beans, cabbage, squash and gabi (taro) for resale.

loans.name: Evelye

texts.en:
Evelye is married with six children and lives in a five-room apartment in the Bamenda Mezam Division of Cameroon. 
She has faced many challenges in her life, amongst which were the death of her father while she was at a tender age and could not take care of herself as well as poverty in her family causing the children not to have adequate education or three square meals per day.
With the new loan of 200.000 frs requested, she will buy pigs, pig feed and a bag of fertilizer to fertilize her farm. She holds strongly the fact that her business will succeed because she has been doing the business for long with regular customers. She is determined to dedicate all her time towards the realization of this project. With this activity, the community will benefit from the animal droppings, thus fertilizing their farming and leading to improved yields. With the profit from this loan, she will educate her children and expand her business. To her, GHAPE loans are preferable because of convenient repayment intervals and low interest rates compared to other organizations.

loans.use: To buy pigs, pig feed and a bag of fertilizer

loans.name: Safa

texts.en:
Safa is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 25 years old, and single. Safa lives with three family members, of whom two are employed. 

Safa owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2010. He built a good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a youth loan of $3,000 to make a display window and install signage and a rolling shutter for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to make a display window and install signage and a rolling shutter for his shop

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 43 years old. He runs a green grocer and is a charcoal dealer in Mombasa. He is a married father of three school-going children. He has been in this business for the last 15 years and has done well. 

He is requesting his second loan to purchase a stock of charcoal and to uplift his green grocer shop. He will use the anticipated profit to reinvest in the business and repay his loan. Being his second loan, the first was paid successfully. He hopes to live a happy life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of charcoal and to uplift his green grocer shop.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana lives in the Kutaisi District. She is 45 years old and lives with her grown son. Both family members are unemployed at the moment, and they have no source of income. Manana has requested loans from local credit providers several times, but her loan requests are always rejected because of low income and the lack of experience in new business. 

Her current loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. 

Manana owns a disordered plot of land, which she will clean and make even using the loan funds. After the land is leveled off, Manana will sell it in lots. This will improve the family's income and raise their standard of living. This will also help the family to earn enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market.

loans.use: to level off and clean land for sale.

loans.name: Munguntsetseg

texts.en:
Munguntsetseg, 28, is a married lady who lives with her family in a ger, a Mongolian felt tent, in her father’s yard. She has two daughters, ages 2 and 7. Her older daughter attends primary school. Munguntsetseg’s spouse drives a mixer machine.  

She supports her family by operating a butcher stall in the second largest outdoor market of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) to increase her current assets.

loans.use: to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji is married with seven children and lives in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon.
She has faced many challenges in life, among which were the death of her husband, leaving her alone to cater for their seven children, the death of her sister who was a great support to her after her husband’s death, the death of her father and mother, who also were people of great help to her after her husband’s death, as well as inadequate finances to cater for her children's medication and feeding.
With the new loan requested, she will expand her poultry business by buying more chicks, feed as well as engaging in the buying and selling of firewood. She holds a positive view that her business will succeed because she is well-versed with business tactics, rears a good breed of chicks and also sells at reduced prices compared to her competitors. With this activity, the community will benefit from a high breed of chicks at moderate prices.
The profit from this loan will be used for the education of her children and expanding her business. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest.

loans.use: To buy and sell firewood as well as engaging in poultry farming

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en: Adelina, 59, is married and has nine children, all of whom are already married. She has owned and operated her vulcanizing shop for almost 18 years and earns PHP 22,500 a month. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 to purchase an electric motor for her shop, in order to improve her business. According to Adelina, she earned money for two of her children to go abroad to work there as overseas Filipino workers.

loans.use: to purchase an electric motor for her vulcanizing shop, in order to improve her business.

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es: Teresa del Carmen de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia; ella se dedica a la  venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, posee en variedad camisas, faldas, vestidos, pantalones entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias; comercia de forma ambulante y desde su hogar, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles, con producto de calidad y con un servicio excelente; Teresa es una mujer emprendedora y muy dedicada a su labor, siempre esta luchando por lo que desea y no piensa rendirse hasta alcanzar el éxito que se merece, en los últimos meses aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. Teresa del Carmen tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Teresa del Carmen is 40 years old and lives with her husband and their children in their own home.  She sells women's, men's, and children's clothing.  She sells a variety of shirts, skirts, suits, pants, and other items.  She has done this work for many years and now has a lot of experience which helps her increase her income.  She sells her clothing door-to-door and from her home.  She has many regular clients that prefer buying from her because she always provides what they need, offers affordable prices, sells only high-quality items, and provides excellent service.

Teresa is an entrepreneurial woman that works very hard.  She always fights for what she wants and never stops until she is successful. In the last few months, demand for her clothing has increased.  She wants to take advantage of this opportunity but doesn't have the capital she needs to purchase more clothing to sell.  Therefore, she is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL so that she can purchase more clothing.  Teresa del Carmen has great references and is very responsible.  She assures us that she will be able to repay the loan and at the same time she is confident that she will be able to better provide for her household.

loans.use: to buy clothing for sale.

loans.name: Federosi

texts.en:
Federosi is 46 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is widowed and has four children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past four years, Federosi has been working hard to manage her restaurant.

To help expand her business, Federosi has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more fresh foods, such as raw bananas and beans, for sale. This will help Federosi to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her remaining children and provide her family's basic needs. Federosi hopes that in the future she will be able to complete construction of rental houses. 

Federosi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Federosi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy foods such as raw bananas and beans for sale.

loans.name: Zaman

texts.en:
Zaman is from Iraq. He is 35 years old and single. Zaman lives with six family members, three of whom are employed. 

Zaman owns a small cafeteria. He established his business in 2010, and now he has an employee. He built up experience in this field, and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Zaman is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD to make a display window and install an external ceiling and a rolling shutter for his café. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to make a display window and install an external ceiling and a rolling shutter for his café.
